loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 48-year-old married man from Qalqilia. He is a father of a son and a daughter who are studying in the university. Ali is a worker in a local factory and his low income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ali lives in an old house in poor condition. He would like to move into a new house so he and his family will live in better conditions. 
Ali requested a USD $2,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay to complete his new house, especially painting and some decorating. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to finish his house as soon as possible and move into it. 
In the photo, Ali appears in his unfinished house.

loans.use: to pay to complete his new home especially painting and some decorating.

loans.name: Luza Group

texts.en:
This group is called Luza, and it is comprised of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Zahra is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is an entrepreneur, and she has been sewing shoes for five years.  She is totally dependent on the income from this business, to feed her family and to cover their living expenses.

She took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Her purpose in taking the loan was to purchase an industrial sewing machine for making shoes. This loan will help her to meet the demand of her clients. She hopes to improve her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine, for making shoes.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Residing in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Phan is 51 years old and is married with six children. She earns a living through farming rice and corn in the local area. Having been in these businesses for 20 years, Phan is able to earn about KHR 27,000 per day, and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phan has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully repaid the past loan, which has enabled her family to have enough food. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her plantation so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 46, lives with his wife and five children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Out of his five children, three are still in school. To feed the family, Chan is a motor-taxi driver while his wife grows oranges on their farm to earn extra income for the family. Having been in these businesses for 10 years, they can earn about 46,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Chan has been with VisionFund for six loans and completely repaid the past loans which have helped better support his business. Now, he is leading his group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. Chan hopes to increase his crop yields so as to generate more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Antonia Magdalena

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde un inicio, la mamá del cliente se dedicaba al negocio de la producción de jabón prieto, la cual ha pasado por algunas generaciones.  De ahí en adelante, ha emprendido en esta actividad que le ha resultado bastante productiva.  Ella empieza a trabajar desde las 6 am hasta las 5 pm, con su esposo e hijos que la ayudan cosntantemente.  Mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene 10 hijos, de los cuales 4 viven con ella.  Desea invertir el préstamo en materia prima para su negocio, como piñón, leña y legía.
texts.en: The client is from Portoviejo.  At the beginning her mother worked making 'jabón pireto' [natural soap] which had passed down through several generations.  From then on she’s been in this same activity and it’s been quite productive.  She starts work at 6am and goes until 5pm with constant help from her husband and children.  She’s in a common law relationship and has ten children four of which live with her.  She wants to use the loan to buy raw materials like pine nuts, firewood and lye.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Santos' Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LUNA LUNITA,  Está  compuesto por trece integrantes Diez mujeres y tres varones,   el presidente del banco es el Sr. Santos tiene 57 años y seis hijos  que ya son mayores de edad,  su actividad económica es venta frutas según a la temporada, el se dedica a esta actividad hace 20 años, el destino del crédito es para la compra fruta de la temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, el Sr. Santos es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, el tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Bolívar en uno de los mercados de la zona, el deseo de el Sr. Santos es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Luna Lunita” (Moon Little Moon) communal bank consists of 13 members, ten women and three men.  The bank president is Santos who is 57-years-old and has six children who are all adults now.  His economic activity is selling seasonal fruit, an activity he’s been in for 20 years.  

The loan is earmarked for the purchase of seasonal fruit at wholesale for his stand.  Santos is a hardworking man since this is his only source of income.  He feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.  

His sales stand is in the Bolívar zone in one of the zone’s markets.  Santos’ wish is to have a store where he can offer a variety of products while increasing his clientele to generate higher income.  He feels happy and grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan is a 34-year-old woman, who lives in a rural village of the Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 15 years. The current business earns her about 33,000 KHR per day.

Nan has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and successfully repaid her previous loans. Now she is applying for another loan, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR, from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to reap a greater crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin is 45 years old and has four children. Currently, her one child is still in school and relies on her. She earns a living though rice farming on five hectares of her farmland which she has been doing for 27 years. This is fourth cycles for Sarin with VisionFund, and she has successfully paid back the past loan. She feels confident that she can improve her living condition so she leads a group of two members to take a new loan. She and her one group member are seeking a loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming. She hopes to make more income so that she can better her lifestyle and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is a 47-year-old father of two children who lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is a rice farmer who has worked in the rainy season field on eight hectares on his farmland for 25 years. The current business has a return of about 30,500 KHR per day. This is his fourth loan with VisionFund with the others fully repaid. Thoeurn and his two group members requested a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers for rice growing. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yields from rice farming, earn more income, and have more savings and a better living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija de 23 años de edad, posee una tienda donde vende aceite, golosinas, refrescos, salsa de tomate, sopas, azúcar, arroz, etc. tiene mucha clientela porque tiene la tienda muy surtida y con lo que los clientes necesitan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña lorenza esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y frijol por quintal ya que ha tenido mucha demanda con esos granos básico, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarlos, por eso solicita dicho crédito y así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y ella tendrá mejores ganancias par tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hija.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 62, lives in her own house with her 23-year-old daughter.  She owns a store where she sells oil, snacks, soft-drinks, tomato sauce, soups, sugar, rice, etc.  She has many customers because the store is well-stocked with what customers need.  She manages to cover some of her household expenses with profits earned.  

Lorenza is asking for a loan to buy corn and beans by the quintal because these basic grains are in high demand but she’s unable to buy them with what she earns and this is why she’s requesting said loan to be able to provide better customer service and earn higher profits to have better quality of life with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans by the quintal.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old. He lives in Irbid-Jordan with his family which consists of five members. Mohammad is studying for his Bachelor of Cooling and Heating Engineering and is in his fourth year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to improve his financial situation. As Mohammad is currently facing a financial problem, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Maureen Auxiladora

texts.es: Maureen es una mujer exitosa de 26 años de edad, soltera. Su negocio es la venta de cosmético de la Avon, y venta de ropa nueva desde hace 1 año,  ha demostrado ser una persona responsables en sus pagos su mama le ayuda a la comercialización de los cosméticos que distribuye  en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como perfume de varón, perfumes de damas,  lapiz labiales, mascara, pintura de uñas, crema para manos, crema para pies, cremas faciales, crema para el cuerpo, ropa nueva como blusas, chores, camisetas, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de varón, etc.
texts.en: Maureen is a successful 26-year-old woman. She is single. Her business is selling Avon cosmetics and selling new clothes. She has been doing this for one year. She has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. Her mother helps her to sell the cosmetics, which she distributes in her community. She will invest the loan in purchasing cosmetics, such as cologne, perfume, lip liners, mascara, nail varnish, hand creams, foot creams, facial creams, and body creams, as well as new clothes, such as blouses, shorts, t-shirts, women’s pants, and men’s pants.

loans.use: to purchase Avon cosmetics, such as cologne, perfume, lip liners, mascara, nail varnish, hand creams, foot creams, facial creams, and body creams, as well as new clothes, such as blouses, shorts, t-shirts, women's pants, and men's pants

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena was born in 1956. She is single and lives in Madaba-Jordan. Ameena has been working in baking for five years. She started her project in the kitchen of her own house. Then she expanded her project and started working in an independent kitchen. Her future plan is to participate in bazaars and showrooms in the future to do some marketing for her work. Ameena is currently asking for a loan to buy flour in order to bake bread for her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins, anti-parasite drugs, animal health medicines and agricultural supplies such as manure, weedkiller and pesticides to grow corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village in Pursat province’s Kandieng district, Long is 50 years old and she has three children to take care of. To feed her family, she and her husband have worked hard as rice farmers for 25 years. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Long has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is asking for another loan with VisionFund for 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes to grow healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Chorn is 55 years old and living with her family members in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She has been farming rice for 12 years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day for her future needs.

Chorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Chorn successfully used the loan from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions and now she is confident she can make a living better. Requesting a loan with VisionFund, Chorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y solo vive con uno de sus hijos. se dedica a sembrar maíz desde que tenia 20 años;  fue con su esposo que aprendió por la necesidad de apoyarlo  en traer el sustento para sus hijos,la llevo ha aprender, como beneficiar el cultivo. Luego que lo aprendió su esposo trabajaba para ganar para los frijoles y ella con sus pequeños hijos beneficiaban la milpa. hoy a sus 49 años  ella trabaja en una hacienda,pues su esposo era el que trabajaba, pero al morir,  la dejaron a ella en repuesto de él. A demás,  tiene unas 2 vacas, pues ella siempre, le han gustado los animales,ella dice que se levanta, a las 4:00 a.m. para hacer su desayuno, luego ir a dejar sus animales al potrero,y luego irse al trabajo que le queda como a unos 15 minutos, a pie de su casa,donde trabajan unas 6 horas, y luego regresa a casa,

Ella compra los materiales en la ciudad y para llegar   tiene que caminar a pie uno 35 minutos, pues ella vive a un kilómetro de la carretera, donde pasa el bus que la conduce a la ciudad el recorrido es de unos 40 minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  una bolsa de semilla, 10 sacos de abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. De esta forma, comprara  los insumos para el cultivo, pues el terreno ya lo tiene preparado pero  le hace falta el dinero para los insumos; por eso esta solicitando el préstamo y no dejar de cultivar, debido a que de ahí asegura el maíz para todo el año.  

Su sueño, es  construir su propia casa, pues hoy vive con su hijo; a demás sueña con poder comprar otras tres vacas y a futuro sueña con tener unas 5 vacas lecheras,
texts.en:
Santos, age 49, is a widow and lives with one of her children.  She has been growing corn since she was 20 years old.  It was with her husband that she learned about the need to support him in bringing sustenance to the children.  He taught her how to help the crop.  After she learned, her husband worked to earn a living.  She and her small children took care of the corn.

Now, at age 49, she works at a ranch.  Her husband was the one who worked, but upon his death they allowed her to replace him.  She also has two cows.  She has always liked animals.  She says that she gets up at 4:00 a.m. in order to make her breakfast.  She then goes to leave her animals at the pasture.  Then she goes to work, which takes her some 15 minutes walking from her house.  She works six hours and then returns home.

She buys the materials in the city.  In order to get there she needs to walk for 35 minutes.  She lives one kilometer from the road on which the bus to the city goes.  The trip is 40 minutes.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy a bag of seeds, ten sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.  This way she will buy the supplies for the crop.  She already has the land prepared, but she needs the money for the supplies.  That is why she is requesting the loan so that she can plant.  This will guarantee corn for the whole year.

Her dream is to build her own house.  She now lives with her son.  She also dreams of being able to buy three more cows.  In the future she dreams of having five dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a bag of seeds, ten sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Munir Group

texts.en: This group is called Munir and consists of four women. Shwaia is a 28-year-old married woman and comes from Taiz, Yemen. She is a hardworking housewife. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Al-Najat Group

texts.en: Al-Najat is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB. Najah is a 43-year-old married woman who has four children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. So, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for building her house.

loans.name: Elsi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsi, tiene 25 años de edad, es una madre soltera que posee bajo su responsabilidad a su hija de 8 años, que  asiste a la escuela y se encuentra cursando su primer grado y su hijo de 6 años de edad.

También, es responsable de sus dos hermanas, una de 18 años y 16 años de edad, que está estudiando el 9°; por lo que el papá le envía dinero de Estados Unidos para los gastos de alimentación y  educación.

Cuando tenía 18 años encontró trabajo en una cafetería, fue en este tiempo donde conoció al papá de sus hijos y con quien no convive desde hace 5 años, debido a que no pudieron superar diferencias. Por  la falta de apoyo, dejó de trabajar y se quedó en su casa cuidando sus niños y fue entonces que decidió iniciar con una pequeña tienda y venta de pupusas, valiéndose de la confianza de que fue capacitada en atención al cliente en el trabajo que recién dejaba.

Su vivienda se encuentra en una comunidad en la zona rural, a una distancia aproximada de 7 kilómetros de la ciudad, lugar donde va todos los sábados por la mañana a realizar las compras de los productos para la venta en la tienda y las materias primas para hacer las pupusas. De su casa a donde toma el bus se recorre como medio kilómetro por calles balastadas, donde es apoyada por sus hermanas con el acarreo de la mercadería.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un  préstamo con otra institución y el resto para comprar productos de primera necesidad como jabones, detergentes, cereales, refrescos, etc. Con el fin de incrementar su mercadería.

De esta manera, Cancelara un préstamo en el que está pagando semanalmente e interés muy altos; además, el de mejorar su capacidad de oferta al tener mas productos en venta a disposición de sus clientes.

Desea construir una galera que le permita atender a sus clientes, donde ellos se sientan confortables; así como hacer crecer su tienda en la casa de sus padres ó irse a instalarse en  la ciudad.
texts.en:
Elsi, 25, is a single mother with an 8-year-old daughter attending first grade and a six-year-old son in her care.  She’s also responsible for two sisters, an 18-year-old and a 16-year-old, who is in 9th grade; her father sends her money from the United States for their food and school costs.

When she was 18 years old she found work in a cafeteria and that was when she met her father’s children though she’s not lived with him for the last five years because they were unable to overcome differences.  Due to the lack of support she had to stop working and stay home to care for her children and that’s when she decided to start with a small store and to sell ‘pupusas’ [filled grilled corn cakes] taking advantage of the training and experience in customer service she’d gotten at the job she was leaving.

Her house is located in a rural community about 7 kilometers from the city, a place she goes to every Saturday morning to buy the products to sell in the store and the raw materials for the pupusas.  She walks a half-kilometer gravel road from her house to the bus stop and her sisters help her carry the merchandise.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to pay off a loan with another institution and the rest will be to buy basic staples like soap, detergent, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. to increase her stock.

In this way she’ll pay off a high-interest loan she’s paying weekly and will also improve her offer capacity by having more products on sale at her customers’ disposal.

She wants to build a shed in which to tend to her customers where they will feel comfortable as well as to make the store in her parents’ house grow or to move it to the city.

loans.use: to pay off a loan with another institution and to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Al-Sadaqa Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Sadaqa and is comprised of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to offer better living conditions. They took out a loan of 180,000 YER. Taqia is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, and she is 60 years old. She lives with her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a small house. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with her family, to set up her house. She is aiming to complete her house. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER, and she will use it to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es una persona de familia muy humilde quienes le enseñaron a luchar en la vida, aunque ella no tuvo el privilegio de ir a una escuela, gracias a sus esfuerzos aprendió a leer. se creció a lado de sus padres, viene de una familia de cinco hermanos (tres hembras y dos varones), quienes apoyaban a sus padres a trabajar en la agricultura y a la elaboración de cumas y machetes (jarcia).

A los quince años, se acompaño con su esposo, luego con el tiempo se casaron por la iglesia, ahora tiene cinco hijos (tres hembras de 20,12 y 7 años, y dos varones de 18 y 15 años), tres de ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, les queda a cinco minutos caminando, su hija mayor le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, y su hijo trabaja de ayudante de albañil con su padre quien trabaja la albañilería.

Ella hace 20 años comenzó a vender especies (ajo, achote, canela, cominos, pimienta, y otros), vende también ropa en ocasiones en las comunidades aledañas, ademas hace dos años comenzó a destazar cerdos para vender en los caseríos del pueblo.

la mercadería,  la  va comprar hasta la ciudad que esta ubicada en otro departamento, y lo hace acompañada de su esposo; tiene que pagar un carro particular que le haga el viaje, el cual lo hace cada dos veces al mes, le toma de tiempo una hora para llegar a la ciudad donde compra las especies.

Los cerdos los compra en la comunidad y los va ha destazar donde su mamá; pues esta fuera del pueblo y ahí obtiene mejores ingresos económicos. todos los sábados destaza cerdos, se va un día antes a quedarse donde su madre para madrugar a las tres de la mañana a destazar, lo hace en compañía de su hijo, quien es el que puede destazar y ella prepara para ir a vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa para vender en la temporada de las vacaciones de agosto, invertirá $300.00 (ropa para todas las edades) y a demás invertirá $300 en la compra de tres cerdos para el destazo, y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de especies.

con el crédito, dispondrá de un inventario mayor para la venta de su mercadería (especies), ademas podrá garantizar su trabajo en el destazo los días sábados en la comunidad, pues tendrá los tres cerdos que ira destazando cada semana. Obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos para su familia, pues es ella quien le ayuda al esposo para darles lo necesario a sus hijos, es conocedora del negocio de las ventas.

 sueña construir una casa de bloque en el futuro, y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en el estudio. pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar dos terrenos , que es donde ella vive.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old, married and has five children. She is a homemaker. She is very humble. She had to learn how to work, as she doesn’t have the benefit of an education. Thanks to her own efforts, she did learn how to read. She grew up in her parent’s home. She has five siblings (three females and two males) who help support her parent’s work in agriculture. Her parents also make machetes and long knives. At fifteen years old she was married in the church. She has five children (three girls who are 20, 12 and 7 years old and two boys who are 18 and 15 years old). Three of her children study at the school in her community. The school is a five-minute walk from their house. Her oldest daughter helps with the housework. Her son assists his father, who is a bricklayer. For the past twenty years Maria has sold spices (garlic, cinnamon, cumin, paprika among other types of spices). She also sometimes sells clothes in the neighboring villages. Also, two years ago, she began to butcher pigs. She sells the meat to households in the village. She buys her merchandise in the city, which is located in another department. He husband goes with her when she travels to the city. She has to hire a car to get to the city. She makes this trip two times a month. It takes an hour to get to the city where she buys her goods. She buys the pigs in her community and she butchers them at her mother’s house. This house is located outside of her village. This location is good for sales. Every Saturday she butchers pigs. She goes to her mother’s house on Friday so she can get up at three in the morning to butcher the pigs. Her son comes with her. Her son actually butchers the pigs and she sells the meat. The loan, that she is requesting, from the Countryside Foundation, will be used to buy clothes that she will sell during the August vacation season. She will invest $300.00 in clothes for all ages. The other $300.00 she will use to buy three pigs that will be butchered. The rest of the money will be used to buy spices on credit. She will then have a larger inventory of spices to sell. She will also be able to guarantee that she will have pork to sell on Saturdays. She will have three pigs, which will last her three weeks. This will give her family a larger income. She helps her husband to provide the necessary items for their children. With the earnings from her businesses she hopes to build a concrete house and also help her children with their education. Thanks to her efforts, she has already purchased two pieces of land, which is where she lives.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell during the August vacations season. She will invest $300.00 in clothing for all ages, $300.00 in three pigs that she will butcher and the rest of the money will be used to buy spices.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es:
Betsy tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos.
Betsy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de trozos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Tiene un espacio donde puede preparar las maderas..
Se inicio hace más de 08años, con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su padre  en la preparación y venta del carbón.Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta de poder contar con un capital de trabajo gracias a la institución, así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. 
Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones que son los desechos de madera.
texts.en:
Betsy, 26, is married living in her own house with her husband and two children.  Betsy works making and selling charcoal made from pieces of wood from nearby sawmills.  She has space where she’s able to prepare the wood.

She started over 8 years ago with  quite a bit of effort and to date continues doing it with her father’s help in making and selling the charcoal.  She decided to start her activity because she needed to have a source of income to support her family.

Therefore, seeing the good results and profits she nets, she wants to continue with her business and maintain it since it’s her only source of income.  This is her first Kiva loan and she feels happy about being able to rely on working capital thanks to the institution so that she can fill her pending orders.

She will use the 800 new soles to buy her main raw material, waste lumber, to make charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal-making raw materials.

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Residing in the Mok Kampul district of Kandal province, Kimly is 44 years old. She earns a living through selling rice and coffee in the village. Having been in this business for nine years, Kimly is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Kimly has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully repaid the loans that have enabled her to improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fees for her son to study English Literature in the local university. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in school until graduation in order to get a good job to support and improve the family.

loans.use: To cover all the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 65 años de edad, esta casada con Palermo y vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Nélida se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y la venta al por menor de cerveza y otras bebidas. Además tienen como ingresos extras el alquiler de su mototaxi. Se inicio en este negocio buscando mejoras para su familia y para percibir mejores ingresos económicos. Desde mucho tiempo atrás Nélida tenia pensado poner un negocio pero por la falta de capital no podía llevarlo a cabo, es así que decidió ahorrar y apoyar a su esposo en la chacra vendiendo los productos agrícolas que cosechaban y con las ganancias que obtenía empezó a comprar poco a poco algunos abarrotes, es así como empezó a surgir y ahora con el pasar de los años tiene un negocio estable que le ayuda a mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para implementar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1000 soles para la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en:
Nélida, 65, is married to Palermo and lives in her own house with her children.  Nélida works selling food items and also sells beer and other beverages at retail.  She earns extra income leasing out her motortaxi.

She started in this business seeing improvement for her family and to earn income.  For a long time Nélida had thought about setting up a business but because of lack of capital had been unable to do so.  So she decided to save up and help her husband in the field selling the agricultural products they grew.  With the profits she earned she gradually started to buy some grocery items and that’s how she started to surge and now with the passage of time she has a stable business that helps her improve her standard of living and to offer her family a better future.

This is her fist Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity that presents itself to her to obtain a line of credit that will be very useful for her business.  On this occasion she will request 1,000 soles to buy grocery items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a training course in fusion cuisine.

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en:
Fualaau is 42 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, banana, taamu and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Fualaau needs a loan to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, taro root and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Fualaau will use the profits from her sales to assist with her family's daily needs and support her children's education as well.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, taro root and a spade

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en: Sabreen was born in 1986. She is married, but has no children. Her husband was a medic for the military and is currently working in a private company. Sabreen has been working in selling blankets for two years. She started her project by selling them to her neighbors, and then it expanded to selling them to other people. She is planning to expand her project and bring new products like cosmetics and perfumes to trade. Sabreen is currently requesting a youth loan to be able to buy new blankets during the summer in order to benefit from wedding preparations going on.

loans.use: To buy new blankets and resell them

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a conservative woman, so she let one of her close relatives take her place in the picture. Samar was born in 1967. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a car retailer and works in photography. Samar started selling foodstuffs five years ago. She started her project by selling candy and desserts, then her project expanded with opening her own supermarket and selling foodstuffs in general. Samar is planning to expand her project in the future. Now she is seeking a loan to buy new merchandise of foodstuffs, in order to resell them.

loans.use: To buy new foodstuffs, in order to resell them at her grocery store

loans.name: Hergelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Hergelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising chickens and pigs. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, bread, oil charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Hergelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, bread, oil charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Las Flores 02 Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO LAS FLORES ESTA CONFORMADO POR TRES SEÑORAS HABITANTES DEL BARRIO NUEVA ESPERANZA EN LA CIUDAD DE PUEBLO NUEVO A UNOS 60 KM AL NORTE DE LA CABECERA ESTELI, CADA UNA DE LAS MIEMBROS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL NEGOCIO QUE DESEMPEÑAN YA QUE SE HAN DEDICADO A ESTAS LABORES DESDE HACE MAS DE TRES AÑOS Y SON MUY CONOCIDAS EN EL BARRIO.

 LAS MIEMBROS SON DOÑA EYRA ELIZABETH QUE ES CASADA Y DOS HIJOS Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS DE MAÍZ Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA ELLA VENDE NACATAMALES, ELISABETH DEL SOCORRO QUE ES CASADA Y CON UN HIJO Y TAMBIÉN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS A DIARIO Y VENTA DE MAÍZ POR QUINTALES Y LA SEÑORA IVANIA QUIEN ES SOLTERAS SIN  HIJOS A SU CARGO YA Y QUE VENDE HELADOS, PALETAS DE SABORES Y COCHO BANANOS ASÍ COMO FRESCOS HELADOS. ellas solicitan un prestamos para compra de maiz e ingredientes para elaborar el producto que comercializan.

LA SEÑORA IVANIA TRABAJA A DIARIO EN LA ELABORACIÓN DE DE FRESCOS NATURALES LOS CUALES VENDE EN BOLSA, TAMBIÉN ELABORA LOS CHOCO BANANOS QUE SON BANANOS MADUROS RECUBIERTOS CON CHOCOLATE Y QUE SE VENDEN HELADOS, TAMBIÉN VENDE LAS FAMOSAS HELADOS QUE SON PEQUEÑOS FRESCOS EN BOLSAS QUE SE VENDEN CONGELADOS Y HAY DE VARIOS SABORES, ESTOS SON PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO Y LA DEMANDA SON LOS ALUMNOS DE LOS COLEGIOS ASÍ COMO EL RESTO DE PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN EL BARRIO, IVANIA ES MUY CONOCIDA POR EL PRODUCTO QUE ELLA OFRECE Y TIENE UNA DEMANDA ESTABLE, ADEMAS ELLA LOS FINES DE SEMANA DE POR MEDIO ELLA VENDE MERCADERÍA EN LAS COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS A LA CIUDAD DE PUEBLO NUEVO. LA SEÑORA EYRA A DIARIOS LOS SIETE DÍAS DE LA SEMANA ELABORA TORTILLAS A BASE DE MAÍZ Y LAS VENDE A LOS VECINOS LA MAYORÍA PERSONAS QUE TRABAJAN FUERA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA ELABORA Y VENDE LOS NACATAMALES Y SUS MISMOS VECINOS LO COMPRAR YA QUE ES UN ALIMENTO DE GRAN DEMANDA. LA SEÑORA ELIZSABETH ELABORA TAMBIÉN TORTILLAS Y LAS VENDE EN SU MISMO VECINDARIOS Y TAMBIÉN COMPRA Y VENDE MAÍZ POR QUINTALES YA QUE ES UN GRANO BÁSICO DE MUCHA DEMANDA.

ESTE GRUPO ESPERA CON ESTE FINANCIAMIENTO OBTENER UNA MEJOR PRODUCCIÓN Y POR ENDE MEJORES VENTAS Y DE ESTA MANERA AUMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS. ELLAS SE MUESTRAN POSITIVAS QUE LES SERA APROBADO EL FINANCIAMIENTO Y PODRÁN IR MEJORANDO SUS UNIDADES PRODUCTIVAS Y MEJORAR POSITIVA MENTE SUS NIVEL DE VIDA.
texts.en:
The Las Flores Group is made up of three women who live in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood in the city of Pueblo Nuevo which is 60 km north of Carbeceria Esteli.
 Each one of the members has experience in their business since they have done this work for more than three years and are very well known in the neighborhood. 

The members are Eyra Elizabeth who is married and has two sons. She makes and sells corn tortillas and on weekends she sells nacatamales. 
Elisabeth del Socorro is married and has one son, also sells tortillas on a daily basis as well as corn flour. 
Ivana is single with no children and sells ice cream. She has different ice cream flavors as well as "cocho bananos" and  flavored soft drinks. They women are seeking loans to buy corn and ingredients to increase the products that they sell.

Ivana works daily preparing the ice water which she sells in bags. She also makes the "cocho bananos" which are frozen bananas covered in chocolate. 
She also sells the famous soft drinks which are frozen soft drinks sold in small bags. There are different flavors. These are products for daily consumption and the demand comes from students in schools as well as other people living in the neighborhood.  
Ivana is well known for the product she offers and has a stable demand. Also on weekends she sells merchandise in the neighboring communities and in the city of Pueblo Nuevo. 
Eyra makes corn tortillas seven days a week and she sells them to the neighbors who work outside and on weekends she makes and sells nacatamales and the same neighbors buy them. 
Elisabeth also makes tortillas and sells them in the same neighborhoods.  She also buys and sells corn flour since it is a big basic staple in high demand. 
This group hopes that with this loan they will be able to have higher production and will be able to improve their sales and increase their income. They are positive about their loan being approved and that they can continue improving their products and their lives

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, wooden sticks and flavors.

loans.name: Al-Olify Group

texts.en: Al-Olify is a group that consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are women who work hard in order to increase their income. Mlok is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in poor conditions in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife who intends to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She said the amount she had is not enough to buy what she needs. Therefore, she requested for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Age 43 and a rural villager from Moung Russey district, Touch is married and one of the breadwinners of her family. She has seven children. Her one son is still dependent on her and in school. She is a farmer who has grown rice in the rainy season on 10 hectares of farmland for 24 years. Touch is a four-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid her prior loans. Her past loans have helped her to improve her living conditions. Now, she and her group member are requesting a new loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to make more income to make her living conditions become more prosperous and better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is a 41-year-old married mother of three children who lives in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns and manages a pottery manufacturing business making and selling assorted pots for sale. She has been doing this business for more than five years and it helps her family as well as the workers in her business. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to finance the costs of pottery making. She hopes to expand and improve her business to uplift her standard of living and be able to provide work in her community.

loans.use: to finance the costs of pottery making

loans.name: Yajaira Celina

texts.es: Yajaira es originaria de Teustepe, tiene una pulpería. Ella realizo su primer préstamo con kiva para invertir en su pulpería, compro productos tales como: granos básicos, cuadernos y ropa escolar, lo cual fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo invertir en su  negocio. Está solicitando este nuevo crédito para comprar ropa, granos básicos, jabón, aceite entre otros. Este financiamiento le ayudara aumentar sus ingresos, ya que tendrá variedad de productos logrando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta futura es ahorrar dinero y dejar de utilizar créditos.
texts.en:
Yajaira is a native of Teustepe, and has a store. 

She executed her first loan with Kiva  to invest in her store, and bought products such as staple foods, notebooks and school uniforms, which was very helpful as it allowed her to invest in her business. 

She is asking for this new loan to buy clothes, staple foods, soap and oil, among others. This funding will help her increase her income, as she will have a variety of products succeeding in satisfying her clients' necessities.

Her future goal is to save money and stop using loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes, staple foods, soap and oil, and other goods for her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing boat and fishing materials for her fishing business.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing boat and fishing materials

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old and married with six children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, coffee, groceries, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from direct selling of Avon products and farming coconuts.

Mary Ann aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, nescafe, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Abdulwahd

texts.en:
Abdulwahd is 20 years old and a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He mentions that he has been involved in selling cosmetics, clothes and perfumes, for two years. He started this business in partnership with his cousin. When he had been taught how to develop in this business, and had saved a small amount, he bought his cousin`s share. He faced problems in his life, to establish his business.

The location where he sells his products is in a market in Sana`a. There is a lot of activity in his area, as far as all types of arts and crafts are concerned. Because of his good customer skills, he is able to attract more shoppers. He would like to expand his business, so he took out a youth loan of 500,000 YER. He will use this amount to stock his business with cosmetics, clothes and perfumes. He wishes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to stock his business with cosmetics, clothes and perfumes.

loans.name: Sinak's Group

texts.en:
Sinak is a 27-year-old young mother of one son who is too young for school. Her family is living in a rural village in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland. She also raises pigs for additional income. Her husband works for other fees to earn extra income. 

She has been involved with this business for five years and earns about 23,900 KHR per day. She is a group leader for a 2-person group. This is her second time borrowing from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She fully repaid her previous loan, which provided her with better living conditions. Now she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR, while her other group member is applying for 800,000 KHR. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for other fees associated with farming and raising pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the crop yield and help her pigs grow quickly so they can be sold for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Gagau

texts.en:
Gagau is 55 years old and married. She has eight children. She has a small plot of land, where she grows taro, bananas, taamu and yams. She can sell these, in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Gagau needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro root, barbed wire and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. Gagau will use the profits from her sales to help her family, including help with the children's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, taro root, barbed wire and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma es una microempresaria de éxito su negocio es la venta de zapatos deportivos y de cueros, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años, tiene tres hijos ya mayores de 45, 43 y 42 años quienes le ayuda uno de ellos en la comercialización de los productos, es madre soltera, tiene dos años de ser clientes de la institución y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos deportivos como Adidas, Reebok, Pumas etc., uno de sus logros fue pagar el crédito y sus inventarios sufrieron un incremento en las existencias y variedad de los productos.
texts.en:
Norma is a successful businesswoman. She sells sports shoes and leather shoes and has had her business for six years. 

A single mother, Norma has three grown children aged 45, 43, and 42. One of them helps with the business. 

She has been a client of the institution for two years and plans to use the loan money to buy Adidas, Reebok, and Puma sports shoes. One of her successes was paying off the previous loan. Her stock increased in both supply and variety of products.

loans.use: buy Adidas, Reebok, and Puma sports shoes

loans.name: Areen

texts.en: Areen is a conservative woman, so she let her husband take her place in the picture. Areen was born in 1988. She is married and lives with her husband in Madaba-Jordan. Areen has been working with her husband in selling mobile phones for two years. He started his project with selling accessories. Then it expanded to selling mobile phones at their own store, and they recently bought a photocopy machine as he was working close to the new court. They didn't face any obstacles through their work because their store was the only mobile phone store in the area. Areens' husband is currently seeking a youth loan to buy new mobile phones and re-sell them to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy new mobile phones for her and her husband's store

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  aprendió el oficio de agricultor y la crianza de ganado desde que era muy pequeño, fue su papá quien le enseño. Él se creció  en una situación económica muy difícil  nunca fue a la escuela solo fue empleado en los trabajos de cuidar ganado y en las actividades agrícolas. Fue así como creció con la dedicación al cuido de sus propios animales, y como en El Salvador no hay oportunidades de un empleo digno, él a encontrado en  las actividades agropecuarias su única fuente de ingresos. Para ello compra novillos pequeños y flacos para engordarlos durante cierto tiempo y luego los vende,; cuida sus animales durante todo el día en los potreros, luego por la tarde los lleva de regreso a casa y esta es una rutina de toda la vida.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 novillos para engorde en repasto. Así,  incrementa su numero de animales, podrá hacer ventas mas continuas y por lo tanto sus ingresos serán mas continuos y esto ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de sus familia

 planea ahorrar dinero de sus ganancias y comprarse un terreno propio para mantener a sus animales..
texts.en:
Fermin is 60 years old, is married and has a son. He learned the trade of a farmer and the raising of cattle from a very young age. It was his father who taught him.

He grew up in a very difficult economic situation. He never went to school, and was only employed in taking care of cattle and agricultural activities. This was how he grew up with the dedication to raise his own animals. 

As in El Salvador, there aren't opportunities for decent employment, he has found his only source of income in agricultural activities. For this purpose, he buys small and skinny steers fatten them for a certain amount of time, and later sells them. He takes care of his animals all day long in the pastures; later in the evening he brings them back home, and this is his lifelong routine.

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy five steers to fatten in pasture. Thus, increasing his number of animals, he will be able to do more continuous sales and therefore his income will be more continuous. This will help improve his family's conditions.

He plans to save money from his earnings and buy his own land to keep his animals.

loans.use: to buy five steers to fatten in pasture.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Mildred is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and additional ducks to raise.

Mildred has been raising ducks for eight years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and rice farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional ducks to raise

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry, who lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, is a 44-year-old married mother of 11 children who tries her best to earn her own income. For more than 10 years, she has managed a pot-making business, earning about 6,500 PHP per month.

A member of Gata Daku MPC, Cherry has requested a loan of 7,000.00 PHP to buy additional clay and pay the labor costs involved in pot-making. She desires to improve her business to achieve better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional clay and pay the labor costs of pot-making

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Noraida works hard to support her family.

She has business making dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fishing. Noraida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Noraida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business

loans.name: Dina Elenita

texts.en:
Dina Elenita, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load) and personal product sales. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in order to purchase more store stocks to sell.

Dina Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Habma

texts.en:
Habma is 44 years old and married with three children.

Habma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Habma has received and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, and buying and selling charcoal and rice.

Habma aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Helina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vending pineapples and selling medicine. Helina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Helina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Angeles requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Angeles would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like rice, eggs, soap, charcoal, shampoo, groceries and other products to sell in her general store business.

Norlita has been in this business for two years. Norlita earns additional income from rice farming.

Norlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like rice, eggs, soap, charcoal, shampoo, groceries and other products to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela tiene 54 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Codavisa al sur de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Graciela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Graciela is 54 years old. She works selling basic staple products in her neighborhood store, which is located in the Codavisa zone, south of the city of La Paz. This loan is her first sequence with the institution. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, such as groceries, sweets and soft drinks. Her reason for requesting the loan is the great demand she has; thus she needs to stock up on merchandise, which will allow her to increase her sales. Graciela faces challenges with her business such as the competition, since there are various stores in the area. She will use the proceeds to buy more merchandise to stock her store and continue growing day by day. Her desire for her business is to keep selling and to have a well-stocked store. Thus, she will be able to expand her business and increase her income, and ultimately improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, vive en una casa alquilada hace más de 12 años en compañía de su esposo. Ana se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, negocio que también comparte con su esposo, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo, hace 10 años que viene desempeñándose en este negocio en  el cual ha adquirido bastante experiencia. Como una mujer emprendedora espera seguir creciendo y hacer crecer su negocio, ofreciendo un buen servicio al cliente y mejores productos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido  y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de S/.1000 soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en: Ana, 54 years old, is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family. She has lived in a rented house with her husband for more than 12 years. Ana sells grocery products, a business that she shares with her husband. Her own house is her workplace. She has had this business for 10 years, and she has acquired a great deal of experience in it. As an entrepreneurial woman, she hopes to continue growing and to make her business grow, offering good customer service and better products. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial help received. She promises to be punctual with her loan repayments. With the amount of 1000 soles, she will buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice and milk, among others

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza is a 40-year-old mother of three.  She wants to augment her family's living, so she runs a sari-sari store selling grocery items in her community. Her husband works as a driver, and she helps him by operating her business.

Mariza borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy home use grocery items and build a store shelter. She hopes to support the needs of her children and send them to school for sake of their future.

loans.use: to buy home use grocery items and build a store shelter

loans.name: Ivania Maritza

texts.es: Ivania Maritza 49 años de edad casada con un hijo independiente, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, ropa(pantalones, camisas, faldas), prendas de oro, plata, chinería, entre otros más, vende de forma ambulante día a día sale desde muy temprano a entregar mercadería y a la misma vez a vender dedicándole unas 10 horas diarias, negocio que tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta forma de ganarse de la vida, ella es muy responsable, trabajadora, ha tenido que luchar muy duro para salir adelante y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo , Ivania tiene clientes fijos y eventuales a los cuales les ofrece al contado y al crédito los que recupera semanal. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de cosméticos (zermat), ropa variada, prendas entre otras.
texts.en:
Ivania Maritza, age 49, is married and has a son who is independent.  She is from the Chinandega municipality.  She sells general merchandise like cosmetics, clothes (pants, shirts, skirts), gold and silver jewelry, and knick-knacks, among other things.  

She sells in an itinerant manner day to day.  She starts to deliver merchandise very early, and she sells at the same time for about ten hours a day.  She has had the business for several years, working this way to earn a living.  She is very responsible and hard-working.  She has had to struggle very hard in order to get ahead and be able to give her son a better future.

Ivania has fixed and casual customers to whom she sells for cash and for credit.  She collects weekly.  The objective of this loan is to buy cosmetics (Zermat), various clothes, and jewelry, among others.

loans.use: to buy products like cosmetics, clothes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya, sont des femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massigui, quartier de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, d’habillements, de condiments, et de la restauration.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales, des habillements,  des condiments et du riz pour la restauration.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
NENE qui est assise à droite  compte acheter avec son prêt des douzaines de complets pour enfants et 10 pagnes wax à Bamako. Ces articles seront vendus à ses clientes au marché et à domicile.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen par semaine de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya Group are married women with an average age of 47 years and an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Massigui, district of Sirifila, village of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through ties of kinship, vicinity and friendship. They sell grain, clothing, vegetable sauces, and prepared foods. The women of the Badenya Group are on their twenty-first group loan, which will be used to buy grain, clothing, vegetables for sauce, and rice for food preparation.

Nene, shown in the photo seated on the right, plans to purchase with her loan several dozen sets of children's clothing and ten full wax pagnes (traditional West African dyed cloth) in Bamako. These items will be sold to her customers at the market and from her home. She hopes to earn an average income of 80,000 Francs CFA per week that she will use to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosenda has an electronics repair shop in the Philippines. Rosenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her shop.

Rosenda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to puchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Pacita has been rice farming for 12 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to puchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sabaly I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  SABALY I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Beniko un des villages de la commune de Beniko,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont la culture de l’arachide, du mil et du gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt Yiridie  la personne au milieu des debout compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.5 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 45.000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabaly I Group are married women with an average age of 40 years, and they have an average of four children. They are living for the most part in polygamous families in Beniko, one of the villages of the township of Beniko, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to better organize their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The crops they grow are peanuts, millet, and okra. The group is on their sixth loan with the institution.

Yiridie is shown standing in the center of the photo. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment, and pay for the labor needed to maintain approximately half a hectare of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the town of Fana to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to earn an income of 45,000 Francs CFA during this agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Sabaly Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABALY II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Beniko un des villages de la commune de Binko,  préfecture de Dioila, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres la culture de l’arachide, du mil, du haricot  et du gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt Kadia la deuxième personne à gauche dans le rang des assises compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide et de haricot. Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110.000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sabaly II Group are married women with an average age of 38 years, and an average of four children. They are living for the most part in polygamous families in Beniko, one of the villages of the township of Beniko, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to better organize their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The crops they grow are peanuts, millet, beans and okra. The group is on their sixth loan with the institution.

Kadia is shown seated second from the left in the photo. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, small equipment, and pay for the labor needed to maintain approximately one hectare of millet, peanuts and beans. After the harvest, her produce is sold in the town of Fana to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to earn an income of 110,000 Francs CFA during this agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es: La Sra. Janneth  tiene 32 años y tiene dos hijos, la Sra. Janneth  se dedica a la  venta de comida, ella vende pollo broaster,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sra. Janneth  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de insumos como papa y aceite  para elaboración de los  pollos a la broaster,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero, para la compra de estos insumos que le hace mucha falta para su negocio, la Sra. Janneth  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela para así generar mayores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su hogar y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Janneth  se siente feliz y agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Janneth is 32 years old and has two children.  Janneth sells food; she sells rotisserie chicken.

This loan is her first cycle within the institution.  Janneth will use this loan to buy supplies like potatoes and cooking oil to make the rotisserie chicken.  The reason for requesting this loan is her lack of money to buy these supplies, which she needs for her business.

The challenge Janneth faces in her business is increasing her customers in order to generate more income.  She will use the profits to buy things for her household.  This way she will improve her family’s quality of life.  Janneth is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell rotisserie chicken.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 29 years old.  She is married and has two children, a two-year-old and a ten-year-old. 

Many years ago, Shova established her own tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used this most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Carlos Lenin

texts.es: Carlos es originario de Teustepe, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, uno de 4,12 y 16 años. Él es comerciante y vende discos compactos de música por unidad hace 13 años de forma ambulante en los departamentos. Él tiene su local propio donde realiza sus ventas con el apoyo de su hija mayor y esposa. Solicita este crédito para comprar cd de música y películas DVD con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y adquirir ganancias, su meta futuro es ampliar su negocio y llegar a vender otros tipos de productos en su local.
texts.en: Carlos is from Teustepe. He is married and has 3 children aged 4, 12, and 16 years. He is a merchant, and for 13 years he has sold music compact discs by the unit as a street vendor in the departments of Nicaragua. He has his own shop where he sells his items with the support of his oldest daughter and his wife. He is asking for this loan to buy music CDs and movie DVDs with the goal of meeting the needs of his customers and making a profit. His future goal is to expand his business and eventually sell other types of products in his store.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and movie DVDs

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru: Шамсия трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети еще маленькие. Старшие ходят в школу. Шамсия начала новый бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Она более 7 месяцев занимается данным бизнесом. Шамсия с бизнесом справляется сама и это у нее прекрасно получается. Шамсия очень любит свою работу и делает это с удовольствием. Она недавно купила новую точку продажи и ей необходимо купить новую партию товара. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shamsiya is a hardworking woman. She is 31 years old. She is married and has four children. The children are still small. The older children go to school. 

Shamsiya began a new business selling children's clothing. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven months. Shamsiya manages the business by herself and she is great at it. Shamsiya very much loves her work and does it with pleasure. She recently bought a new market stall and needs to buy new stock.

She is requesting a loan of USD $2,000 to buy children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for her new business

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марджоне не улыбнулась счастье, и она теперь разведена. Она имеет на воспитание 1 дочь. Марджона живет с матерью и дочерью. Марджона работает в парикмахерском салоне. Она работает как наемный работник. Заработные деньги она использует для обеспечения семьи, так как она является основной кормилицей семьи. Марджона работает в салоне красоты более 1 года. Она постепенно усовершенствует свои знания и навыки. Будущим она планирует открыть собственный бизнес. Она уже несколько месяцев планирует купить телевизор и кондиционер для своего дома, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fortune has not smiled on Marjona, and she is now divorced. She is raising one daughter. Marjona lives with her mother and daughter. 

Marjona works in a hairdressing salon. She works as a salaried employee. She uses her wages to support the family, as she is the main breadwinner. Marjona has been working in a beauty salon for more than a year. She has gradually improved her knowledge and skills. 

In the future, she plans to open her own business. For several months, she has been planning to buy a television and air conditioner for her home, but does not have the money.

She is requesting a loan of USD $1,000.

loans.use: to buy a TV set and air conditioning for her house

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Аскар 27-летний молодой человек, проживающий в районе Рудаки. У него есть жена и дети. Дочери 3 года, сыновьям 4 и 1 год. Аскар очень любит свою семью и всегда старается, чтобы его семья ни в чем не нуждалась. Аскар зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь животноводством. Он разводит мелко-рогатый скот для продажи. Аскар занимается данным видом бизнеса уже три года. Бизнес ему приносит хороший доход. На местном скотном рынке у него имеются постоянные скупщики, которым он и продает свой скот. Аскару в купле-продаже скота помогают его братья. Сейчас Аскару необходимо увеличить поголовье мелко-рогатого скота. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа овец.
texts.en:
Askar is a 27-year-old, young man, residing in the Rudaki region. He has a wife and children. His daughter is three years old, and his sons are four and one. Askar loves his family very much and always tries for his family to have everything that they need. Askar makes a living by raising animals. He breeds small-horned livestock (sheep and goats) for sale. Askar has been involved in this type of work for three years. The business brings him a good income.
