texts.pt: Rostalina é solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam o nível primário e secundário, e o mais novo não tem ainda idade escolar. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos. Trabalha como agente de serviço num hospital público durante 8 horas diárias. A casa onde vive ainda não está concluída, isto é constrói pouco a pouco por causa dos escassos recursos financeiros, por isso o dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai aplicar na compra de areia, cimento, arcos de janela, para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa. No futuro pretende construir dependências para o arrendamento de modo a arrecadar mais dinheiro para o sustento dos filhos. No futuro vai trabalhar mais, e fazer mais empréstimos na Hluvuku de modo a lograr os seus projectos.
texts.en: Rostalina is single and has three children who attend primary and high school. The youngest child hasn't reached school age yet. She lives with her children in a house that she owns. She works an 8-hour day as a service agent in a public hospital. The house where she lives isn't finished yet, that is to say, she's been building it little by little due to scarce financial resources. That's why the money from the recent loan will be used to purchase sand, cement and window frames so she can continue building her house. In the future she intends to build rooms for renting out so that she can obtain more money to support her children. In the future she'll work harder and get more loans from Hluvuku in order to accomplish her projects.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and window frames in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Teodoro Armando

texts.es: Teodoro Armando, mayor de edad casado con tres hijos, todos independientes, originario del municipio de chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, Teodoro se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, luchador responsable, con ganas de superación personal, es propietario de un negocio de venta de granos básicos como: venta de arroz, frijoles , azúcar, aceite, jabón, maíz entre otros productos mas, el cual lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de este municipio, al igual que tiene un tramo de reparación de calzados en el mismo mercado, inicia este negocio con fondos propios de ahorros que el tenia de sus otros trabajos, uno de sus sueños es en un futuro no muy lejano poder adquirir otro tramo para venta de mariscos en el mismo local, el financiamiento de este crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo y comprar granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, aceite, carbón, avenas, hamacas entre otros mas, Teodoro agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Teodoro Armando is a married adult with three children, all independent. He is from the city of Chinandega, an area where commerce predominates. Teodoro is a hard-working man, responsible and a fighter, with a desire for personal growth. He owns a business selling staple goods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, and corn, among other products. It is located in one of the markets of this city. He also has a shoe repair stall in the same market. He started this business with his own savings that he had from his other jobs. One of his dreams is to be able to acquire another stall to sell seafood in the not-so-distant future. The money from this loan is to reinforce his working capital and to buy staple items such as rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, charcoal, oats, and hammocks, among other items. Teodoro is very thankful for the support that the Kiva investors give to people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: for working capital to buy staple goods such as: rice, charcoal, sugar, beans, salt, and detergent, among other products

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Don Carlos es originario del municipio de Teustepe, Boaco. Tiene 39 años de edad, casado y con 3 hijos. Se dedica a la ganadería,  siembra de maíz y frijol. Él está agradecido con kiva y MiCredito ya que atravez de ellos pudo aumentar sus ingresos. Este nuevo crédito lo solicita para comprar unos terneros.
Su meta futuro es comprar una finca que este cerca de la carretera con acceso al agua para poder construir una casa.
texts.en: Carlos is a native of the municipality of Teustepe, in the department of Boaco. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He works raising cattle, and growing corn and beans. He says that he is grateful to Kiva and the field partner because through them he was able to increase his income. He is requesting a new loan to buy calves. His future goal is to buy a property that is near the road with access to water so that he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a woman who understands the importance of going to school. She missed this great chance herself and has vowed to pay every school bill until her children reach the highest level in school that they can.

Monica operates a medium-sized retail shop which is one of her major sources of income. She is an honest, hardworking and focused woman with whom one would want to work. She is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy more goods to sell to her clients.

Monica is grateful for the UGAFODE and Kiva partnership and believes it is her stepping stone to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en:
Nazma, a 29-year-old, hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a driver. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Nazma is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business, if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Nazma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia and her family live in Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a fisherman, and she helps him to earn a living by planting and harvesting vegetables, to sell in their community. For ten years of selling vegetables, she has earned not less than 2,000 a month.

In 2009 she joined GDMPC, and she gained access to microfinance services. Recently, Virginia borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes to improve her vegetable garden and have an abundant harvest, and thereby to gain more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia, 35, is a housewife who adores her family. Her husband is a blacksmith who works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. His work is the family’s only source of income.

Fauzia is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. She will use the loan to buy tools for her husband’s work. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to pay for his household’s needs.

Fauzia hopes that the loan will help her husband's business. She is thankful for Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's work.

loans.name: Jardines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDINES DEL SUR”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de flores, venta de productos de belleza, venta de víveres, venta de edredones y esponjas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida (churrasquería); este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo, ya que este es cheff, esa oportunidad fue aprovechada para emprender su negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de platos y cubiertos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente los utilizara para realizar el servicio en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el ahorro y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "JARDINES DEL SUR" [SOUTHERN GARDENS] communal bank is beginning its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Villa Tejada Regional Office, it is made up of nine members and is directed by a board, of which Angelica is the treasurer. The members of the communal association participate in a variety of businesses, among them candy sales, flower sales, beauty product sales, grocery sales, eiderdown and sponge sales, a corner store, and food sales.

The loan that they intend to take out will benefit the small business owners that Angelica is a member of. She reports that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years, entering by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a food business (barbecue stand). She started this business together with her spouse. Since he is a chef, they took advantage of this opportunity to start their family business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (purchase of plates and cutlery). She will acquire this from the fairs in the city of El Alto and then will use it to provide service in her business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the loans, the savings and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase plates and cutlery

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He has one child. He has been farming for one year.  His primary income sources are milk, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'milking cows.'  His biggest challenge is 'milk price fluctuations.'  Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'Mzungu - European.'

Benard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he answered that his group members told him about the low-interest, asset-financing loans offered by Juhudi Kilimo.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he said he had learned that he can acquire assets and wealth, through small loans.

His highest monthly expense is family living expenses. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family,' Benard replied, 'It will provide enough food.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benard owns a cow and bicycle, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power, but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 45-year-old lady from the Homabay region, in the western part of Kenya. Emily is a widow and supports two people in her family. She has two adult children, 20 and 25-years-old respectively.

Emily's main business is tailoring and she has been in this business for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Emily has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase material for making new clothes. She will use her anticipated profit to expand the business.

Emily's dream is to have a stable business that gives her a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase material for making new clothes.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 41-years-old, married and blessed with two children, aged six and four years respectively. 

Andrew owns a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods. He started this business 13 years ago and earns a monthly income of 35,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

Andrew has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase milk, bread, boxes of biscuits, packets of sweets and bars of soap. The profit he earns will help him to expand this business. Andrew hopes to see his business grow and hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, boxes of biscuits, packets of sweets and bars of soap.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking mother, who is doing what she can to support her family. She is in the business of tailoring. She has been doing this work for three years, now. Her income from her business has been helping her children, who are all in school. Her husband, also a tailor, also works so their dream for their family will come to life.

She would like to apply for another loan, this one in the amount of 12,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread and other materials, to use in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs, including the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maribel hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having their own house and lot. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials, to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur, who retails onions in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years, and she earns additional income from a restaurant business.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell to her customers. Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Bensie

texts.en:
Bensie is 37-years-old, married and lives in Rizal, Jimenez. She runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Bensie has been in business for more than six years and earns 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.

Bensie has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy canned goods, bottled products and seasoning. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bottled products and seasoning

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is married to Veronica and a father to their children. He received a previous loan, which was a big help in his business. The extra income stemming from his loan helped him to send his children to school and meet the family’s everyday expenses. He and his wife are helping each other support their family.

Felimon operates a food stall from which he sells fish and squid balls, quail eggs and other street foods. He is applying for another 40,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells. He knows the more items displayed at the store, the greater the profits. These will definitely help him to cover the family’s daily needs and educational expenses for his children.

Felimon looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He hopes to see his business grow and dreams of giving his family a good life and future.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients, of which Felimon is one, are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a mother of nine children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines. She earns additional income by selling prepaid mobile phone load, prepared foods, raw vegetables, and bamboo and nipa roofing materials, and by raising pigs.

Nelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell. Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Haide works hard to support her family. She has a food market business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Haide is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell at her food market. Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her food store

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo “NUEVA ESPERANZA” es uno grupo conformado por socios trabajadores y emprendedores quienes día a día luchan para mejorar su economía familiar. Maria tiene 58 años es conviviente con hijos todos independientes. El grupo cumple la función de presidenta quien fue elegida por los socios. Maria hace 3 años viene preparando comida para  luego ofrecer a los trabajadores de obras  civiles y a las galerías. Los domingos prepara tamales para ofrecerlos a sus vecinos. Hace muchos años viene participando en el comedor de la zona donde vive. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ollas más grandes. Su mayor deseo es comprar un carrito sanguchero y terminar de construir su casa. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Maria es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: The "Nueva Esperanza" ("New Hope") group is a group made up of hard-working and entrepreneurial members who fight day after day to improve their families' economic situation. Maria is 58 years old and lives with her partner. All of her children are independent. In the group, she carries out the function of president, and was elected by the members. For three years, Maria has been preparing food to offer to construction workers and the general public. On Sundays she makes tamales to offer to her neighbors. For many years she has participated in the community kitchen in the area where she lives. She will use the loan to buy larger pots. Her biggest dreams are to buy a sandwich cart and to finish building her house. The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Maria is the first one on the right side.

loans.use: to buy larger pots

loans.name: Cruz Antonio

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañado, tiene tres hijos; 2 niñas y un niño. Desde hace 35 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y fríjol. Fue su padre quien le enseño desde muy joven. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas y para rastrear la tierra. Así, aplicara todos los insumos que necesita su cultivo, para que se desarrolle en perfectas condiciones para que la cosecha sea abundante. Él considera que continuara trabajando la agricultura para sostener a su familia con todo lo necesario, cultivar más cantidad de terreno. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: Cruz is 41 years old, married and has three children, two girls and a boy. For the past 35 years he has made a living in farming, growing corn and beans. It was his father who taught him the trade from a very young age. He is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Campo to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds and herbicides, and to pay to comb his land. In this way, he will have everything he needs for his crops to grow in perfect conditions for an abundant harvest. He sees himself continue farming to provide his family with everything it needs and to cultivate a larger plot of land. His dream is for his children to get an education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds and herbicides, and to pay to comb his land.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 29 years old and married to Vivian. They have no children, currently. Josphat owns a shop, a business he started a year ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000.

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000. He will use the loan to purchase items to sell at his shop, including bales of maize flour, bags of rice, margarine, cooking oil and tissue paper. The profit he earns will aid him to repay his loan, as well as to expand his business further. 

Josphat's dream is to see himself expand to the extent of opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store, including bales of maize flour, bags of rice, and Blue Band margarine

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years, and she earns additional income from tailoring.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing gear for her fishing business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Ruth Yessenia

texts.es: Ruth Yessenia 30 años de edad soltera con un hijo menor de edad que aun esta bajo su cargo, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, es propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa usada y venta de leche, ella  alquila un local donde atiende su negocio, ella desde muy temprano comienza su jornada de trabajo iniciando con la venta de leche sale por las mañanas y posteriormente abre su negocio de venta de ropa, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, trabajadora, el cual lucha día a día por llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindarle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es de comprar un pequeño solar y ver a su hijo con una carrera profesional en un futuro no muy lejano, Ruth esta solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de tres pacas de ropa usada porque tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes y así ofrecerles variedades de ropa. agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Ruth Yessenia is a 30-year-old single mother with a son under her care. She is a native of the municipality of Chinandega in the western part of the country. She owns a business selling used clothing, and she also sells milk. She rents a store where she tends to her business. She gets up to work very early, starting out selling milk in the mornings and later opening her clothing store. She is known for being a very enterprising, responsible and hardworking woman who fights day to day to bring home food and provide the best for her young son. She has regular and irregular customers. Some of her dreams are to purchase a small plot of land for a home and see her son earn a professional degree in the not-too-distant future. Ruth is requesting the loan to have working capital to purchase three bundles of used clothing because she is experiencing increased demand from her customers and she wants to offer them a variety of clothes. She is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of used clothing containing pants, shirts, dresses and other items.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela. She previously accessed a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy fruits and vegetables for her market stall. Her earnings were a big help for her child's education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Miguela would like to apply for another loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. The profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Miguela dreams of expanding her business and having more stalls. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell at her market stall.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es: Doña Danelia es originaria de Chinandega, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los cuales son independientes. Es comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual es su única fuente de ingreso. Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa, etc. Este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mejores ingresos, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener un mejor nivel de vida y mantener su negocio estable.
texts.en: Danelia is originally from Chinandega. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are independent. She is a merchant and makes a living running a convenience store, which is her only source of income. She is requesting the loan to purchase products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks and other items. This loan will be a big help because she will be able to invest in her business and generate more income, as well as providing a better service to her customers. Her plan for the future is to have a better quality of life and keep her business stable.

loans.use: to purchase products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 56-year-old father. He is married, and they are blessed with four children. Their main source of income is growing crops and farming rice. He has been in this business for almost 20 years. Roberto and his wife are earning a net income of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in farming.

Now, he is requesting a loan amounting to 38,000 PHP. He will utilize his loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow in his farm. He hopes to have a good harvest so as to sell it for a good price to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed to grow for his farm business.

loans.name: Adilia Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Adilia es originaria de la concepción, Masaya. El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para comprar mercadería de su pulpería, el cual fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo invertir en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.
Está solicitando este crédito para comprar productos tales como: granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, frijol, aceite, gaseosas, etc. con el fin de mantener activo su negocio y lograr sus planes futuros, mejorar  la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Adilia is originally from Concepción, department of Masaya. She used the previous loan to purchase merchandise for her convenience store, which was a big help because she was able to invest in her business and earn more income. She is requesting this loan to purchase products, such as basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oil, soft drinks and other items, with the goal of keeping her business active and achieving her plan for the future of improving the stores' infrastructure.

loans.use: to purchase products like basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Shoukat

texts.en:
Shoukat is a 43-year-old man, living with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He works hard to provide better living standards to his three children by selling gift hampers and decoration pieces. He purchases all gifts and decoration pieces from the market and then sells them it to the general public. Most of the sales he makes are at festivals, occasions and ceremonies. He has become famous for providing good quality gifts and has retained many customers. He earns enough money to support a decent life. 

To further improve his business, Shoukat has requested a loan of 100,000 Pakistani Rupees to buy more gift hampers and decoration pieces to increase his sales. This is Shoukat's first loan and he is sure that he will pay all the loan installments on time. 

Shoukat is very experienced in his business and confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment. Shoukat is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy gift hampers & decoration pieces to sell.

loans.name: Skender

texts.en:
Skender is 58 years old, married and a father of four children living together in a southern part of Kosovo. Skender works in a bus station, and his wife works in a hospital as a medical sister, but both receive very low salaries. In an effort to supplement the low income they receive Skender has a flat that he rents out to others for 200 euros a month. 

This apartment is now in need of some renovations so Skender is asking for the first time for a loan to pay for painting and for the façade there. This loan will help him to even further increase his income as once the work is completed, he can charge a larger amount of money for the rent. He hopes by investing in this manner he will be able to save some additional money for his children’s future. He is very happy for this opportunity and he thanks all of the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To pay for painting and a façade of a rental apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 39-years-old, married to Richard and blessed with three children aged 10, 13 and 19 years respectively. 

Tabitha runs a poultry farming business that she started six years ago. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She wishes to boost her business and has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more chicks for rearing. The profit she earns will help her expand her farming business. She dreams of supplying poultry products all over her town.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with four children, aged 15, 13, 9 and 3 years, respectively. He has owned a shop since three years ago and earns a monthly income of 85,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has requested a third loan of 50,000 KES to purchase bales of flour, washing detergent, tissue papers and baby pampers. The profit he earns will aid him in buying more stock for his business. His dream is to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase bales of flour, washing detergent, tissue papers and baby pampers.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. María desde hace dos años forma parte del grupo de Crédito el Cisne, le gusta este tipo de créditos ya que le permiten mejorar la solvencia de su pequeño negocio. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una vegetación exuberante, bellos paisajes y verdes campos, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a tareas del campo como  la crianza de animales, a la agricultura, al comercio y también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora María tiene 54 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, uno de sus hijos está casado y vive independiente, otro de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente, y dos de sus hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora como albañil. 

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual vende la leche.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María has been part of the group Crédito el Cisne (Swan Loans) for two years. She likes this type of loan as it allows her to improve her small business’s credit. 

She lives on the outskirts of the Valle en Cuenca Parish, a place that has vibrant vegetation, beautiful scenery and green fields. Its people are friendly, courteous and hardworking. They do agricultural work like raising animals, farming, and running businesses; they also work in the city in various economic activities. 

María is 54 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has had four children. One of her children is married and lives independently. Another works and helps her out economically. Two of her children are in school. Her husband works as a mason. 

María works in agriculture, and she uses what she harvests to feed her household. She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle, from which she sells milk.

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for all of her animals.

Her dream is for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila se encuentra en el grupo de crédito El Cisne desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a mejorar la amistad con todas sus vecinas y compañeras del grupo y también los créditos le han permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una vegetación exuberante, bellos paisajes y verdes campos, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a tareas del campo como la crianza de animales, la agricultura, al comercio y también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 63 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Doña Zoila labora como empleada domestica de lunes a viernes todo el día, en su casa se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes, cerdos y gallinas, también a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito es para la comprar alimento para sus animales y pollos.

Su meta es incrementar más animales.
texts.en:
Zoila has been in the credit group "El Cisne" [The Swan] for 10 years. In all this time, she has come to have better friendships with all her neighbors and partners in the group. In addition, the loans have allowed her to improve the economic stability of her household. She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Valle in the city of Cuenca, a locale that enjoys exuberant vegetation, beautiful landscapes, and green countryside. Its people are kind, gentle, and hard-working, and dedicate themselves to country work, like the care of animals, agriculture, commerce, and they also work in the city in different economic activities. 

Zoila is 63, married, and has four adult children who are married and live independently. Her husband works in construction. The house they live in is their own. 

Zoila is a domestic worker all day Monday to Friday. At home, she raises cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. She also grows food, which is used for meals in her home. The money from her loan is to buy food for her animals and chickens. Her goal is to obtain more animals.

loans.use: to buy food for animals and chickens.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband share responsibility in attending to their young children and at the same time, earning an income for their daily needs.

Susan is a balut vendor. In the Philippines, balut is a well-known egg that is sold on the sidewalk. It is an egg of ducks that had not been hatched; instead, it was cooked as a boiled egg with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is a highly nutritious food that Filipinos love to eat, especially when they feel tired as it revitalizes their energy and strength. About 450-600 pieces of balut eggs are being boiled and sold every night. She and her husband do the selling to lessen expenses for the commissions of vendors who will sell it. They earn 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales per day. 

Susan is requesting a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP that she will use as additional capital for her business to buy more eggs.

Susan dreams to have a stall located in the market. She still will have to wait a little bit more to make this come true because she has prioritized being a mother first to her young children. For now, she and her husband will just continue to lean on each other to make their small business grow for the sake of their children’s future. She never fails to attend weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to go on with their life no matter what the obstacles are, because she has a big God who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more eggs needed in her business.

loans.name: Jelleny

texts.en: This time, for her ninth cycle loan, Jelleny is borrowing a new loan of 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle transportation business. The general store business that was previously funded through NWTF, Kiva's field partner, continues to provide Jelleny and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 38 years old and married with six children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Flora has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling fruits.

Flora aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Perpetua works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Perpetua is borrowing PHP 30000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Perpetua has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 31 years old and married to John. They are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 8 years, respectively. She owns a shop business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bales of flour, bags of rice and sugar, detergent and soap. The profit she earns will aid her to open an Mpesa (money transfer) shop, which will be a new line of business. Her dream is to see this business expand and one day purchase a business car and a piece of land where she will build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase bales of flour, bags of rice and sugar, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Mariechu

texts.en:
Mariechu is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and e-loading (mobile prepaid load) businesses. Mariechu is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mariechu has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Crestia

texts.en: Crestia lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single and for thirty years, she has operated her own piggery, raising pigs to sell to earn a living. In 2010, she joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to microfinance services and recently, she borrowed a loan to buy feed. She plans to expand her piggery to gain more income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 27 years old. She has a new business which is hog raising. She wants this business to improve their way of living. Due to lack of capital, she's asking for a loan amounting to 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy vitamins and hog feeds for her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and hog feeds.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 19,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna hopes to have more customers and prays that God's guidance will always be upon her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years of age and married to Andrew. They are blessed with four children, aged 25, 20, 17 and 13 years, respectively. She has been selling grocery goods for the past six years and has seen her business grow steadily into a wholesale one. She now earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) after boosting her stock with the first and second loan that she borrowed previously.

She wishes to boost her business and has requested a third loan of 40,000 KES to aid her to purchase more fruits, vegetables and groundnuts for sale. The profit she earns would contribute toward her purchasing a piece of land and building rental houses. She hopes to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits, vegetables and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more retail stock, e.g., sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vanancio

texts.en:
Vanancio is a married man, aged thirty-four with five children all going to school. He is a fishmonger but supplements his income with agriculture, specifically growing bananas. He says he works four days a week and each day he works for 16 hours because he has to stay out longer until he has sold most of the fish because it is perishable. He has been in this business since 2006 and he concentrated on fishmongering due to high demand for fish in the rural areas. This created a market; hence he is able to earn an income to sustain his family.

His main clients are hotels and families plus schools around his home area. His main challenge is the lack of enough capital to keep the business running every day since he has to buy fish directly from the lake and poor preservation methods cannot help him to keep his stock for more days since fish is perishable. 

He describes himself as a hardworking man and appreciates the work of Ugafode in providing financial services to him which will be of great help to his business. He is a hardworking and resilient man. His greatest dream is to take care of his family by providing for them all the required necessities and above all to educate his children.

The photo is Vanancio at his fish stall.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a 34-year-old man from Migori county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports three people in his family and is married to Rosemary, who is a business lady. Together they have two children, whose ages are 9 years old and 9 months old.

He has a retail shop which has been in operation for the last five years and gets a monthly income of KES 40,000. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more stock of goods for his retail shop. He will use the anticipated profit to grow the business.

His dream is to educate his children and buy land and build a good house for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of goods.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 36 years old and married with three children.

Maricris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Maricris has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maricris aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George lives in the town of Kutaisi. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. George is an artisan, working on special orders locally. He gets a small monthly income which isn’t enough to cover the everyday expenses of his family. As the unemployment rate is high in the region and it’s often impossible for people over 40 to find a job, self-employment is the best way for them to earn a living. George’s case is similar. He has recently decided to purchase a car and start a taxi business to get additional income and ensure his family members have better living conditions. George’s loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, George will buy a secondhand car and serve the local people as a taxi driver during his free time. The income of the family will increase and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 32 years old and she operates a salon in Mombasa. She has done this business for five years now. She came to know of Milango when she was attending to one of her clients. They engaged for a while and she decided to join. She doesn't have any other sources of income and this is the sole business for her. She has one child four years old and the child goes to school. The major challenge that she faces in the business is low season experiencing low customer turn out. The extra income that she will raise from using the loan will help her family have better living standards and also educate her child.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer

loans.name: Yovita

texts.en: Yovita is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. She will take the management program in commerce and harbor administration. Yovita wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so she can work in the port. Yovita is the first child of three siblings and comes from East Nusa Tenggara, precisely in the village of Bannae East Nusa Tenggara, which is known as a mountainous area with fertile soil. Her father is a carpenter, whose income depends on the work he gets. Her mother is a primary school teacher near her residence. Yovita hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva investors, so she can finish her education smoothly and can ease the burden on her parents. Yovita is very grateful to Kiva investors who help finance her study.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Valentinus

texts.en: Valentinus wants to apply for a loan to support his studies for three years at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. "I, Valentinus, graduated from high school in Kefamenanu. I want to continue my studies, but could not continue my studies due to limited funds. So I had to work to help my parents, because my parents are just laborers. Parental income per month is not fixed. Depending on the crop, sometimes it is not sufficient for the needs of the family. With this situation then my parents have to work regardless of the rain and heat, even in sickness too, my father still works. I hope and want to become a successful ship navigator and professional. I want to see my parents live peacefully and happily carefree in their old days. I am very grateful to Kiva investors, who help finance my study”.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Servinus

texts.en:
Servinus is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He took the nautical program in accordance with the department while in high school. He's the first child of two brothers and his father works as a farmer only. The harvest received is very dependent on the weather and the income from farming for their daily needs is sometimes lacking. However, all parents want their children to get a good education for the sake of their future. 

Servinus, as the first child, is expected to complete his studies quickly. Due to family circumstances and expectations of his parents, Servinus is applying for a loan from Kiva to help him pay for his studies. Servinus is hoping to quickly finish his studies and quickly get the job he aspires to as a reliable captain.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben's main source of income comes from his corn and coconut production business. He is 30 years old, married with one child and lives in Poblacion, Bonifacio. He has been in farming for seven years, earning an amount of 3,200 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Arben joined GDMPC. Recently, Arben has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Aida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Aida's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en: Marselina is from Cilacap, an area located on the south coast, with a nice view of the beach and the island in sight. There is also a port in Cilacap for ships, Marselina want to be a native daughter who can work and build her own country. Marselina’s hobby is the sport of boxing. She is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara where she will take the program of management of commerce and harbor administration. Marselina's parents work as farmers and with cattle. Their income is not fixed and depends on weather factors. Marselina is eager to help ease the burden of her parents with a program loan from Kiva. She wants to follow this program. Marselina wants to finish school and get a job quickly at a port in her own country. Marselina says thanks to Kiva lenders who with these loans, can help her with her studies for three years.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Kiptarus

texts.en:
Kiptarus lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has three children and has been doing this work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is selling milk! His biggest challenge is market fluctuations in prices. Animals on the farm have been given the names of teta - cattle.

Kiptarus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "My group passed the message from Juhudi Kilimo officers' outreach to me." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he answered how to do farming business in modern ways.

His highest monthly expense is transportation costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Kiptarus replied it would change their living standard.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kiptarus owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and solar power  in the household but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Perez lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has two children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and personal business.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is the transportation of milk to the the local shops! Her biggest challenge is the treatment of parasites causing diseases. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Teta.'

Perez was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that a Juhudi Kilimo officer outreached their group. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session to which she replied, "If you divert the funds loaned to you, you will have problems in repaying."

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Perez replied, "Change of class due to new wealth animals."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Perez owns the following: cows, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and running water in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for sale

loans.name: Mil Estrellas Group

texts.es: Marínela es miembro del grupo que está formado por tres socias, ella es una mujer acompañada, trabajadora, con dos hijos menores de 10 meses y 4 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat, y zapatos por catálogo desde hace 3 años. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas, camisolas, chores, faldas, vestidos etc. Roxana tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de CD al detalle ambulante e Isayana tiene 21 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y variada.
texts.en: Marínela is a member of a group made up of three associates, she has a partner, she is hard working and has two young children who are 10 months and 4 years old. She runs a small business selling cosmetics like Avon and Zermat and also shoes through catalogs. She has been doing this for 3 years. The credit she is applying for will be invested in purchasing men and women's pants, shirts, camisoles, shorts, skirts, dresses etc. Roxana is 25 years old and she runs a small business selling CDs as a street vendor and Isayana is 21 years old and she runs a business selling new clothes with in a wide variety of styles.

loans.use: purchase men and women's pants, shirts, camisoles, shorts, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 38 años se dedica a la siembra maíz y fríjol. Fue su padre quien le enseño. Los insumos los adquiere en la ciudad que esta a 23 kilómetros, de su comunidad y el recorrido lo hace en un vehiculo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, para rastrear la tierra y pago del alquiler del terreno en donde cultivara. Con el préstamo, proporcionara a su cultivo todo lo necesario para crezca y se desarrolle adecuadamente y que al final los frutos de han muy buenos; que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Su sueño es diversificar sus cultivos, brindarles algo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, married, and has two children. For 38 years, he has worked planting and raising corn and beans. His father taught him the business. He buys the supplies he needs in a city that is about 23 kilometers (14 miles) from his community and he gets there by car. 

The loan that he is applying for from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds and herbicides to take care of the land and also to pay the rent on the land he cultivates. With the loan, he will give all he can to his crop so that it grows and produces a good harvest, which will help him to cover the costs of basic necessities. His dream is to diversify his crops and to give a better future to his children.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds, and herbicides to take care of his crop and also pay rent on his land.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana es una de las socias fundadoras del grupo de crédito El Cisne. Le gusta su grupo de crédito por la unión y amistad de todas sus compañeras, y también porque puede conversar de varios temas de su interés en cada reunión. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una vegetación exuberante, bellos paisajes y verdes campos, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a tareas del campo como la crianza de animales, la agricultura, al comercio y también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora Mariana tiene 56 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cinco de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de  la localidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es  propia.

Doña Mariana trabaja en la dura tarea del campo, cría cerdos, cuyes y pollos, también labora en la agricultura y sus cosechas vende en su comunidad.

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, alimento para sus animales y abono para mejorar sus cultivos. 

Su meta es realizar un galpón de pollos más grande y así crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is one of the founding members of the group El Cisne (the swan). She likes her communal bank group because of the unity and the friendship she shares will all the members, and also because she is able to talk to them on various topics pertinent to her whenever they meet. She lives on the outskirts of the parish Valle en Cuenca, a place that enjoys an abundance of vegetation, beautiful landscapes, and green fields. The people here are friendly, gentle, and hard working, they work mostly in the fields and raising livestock, but also work in commercial businesses and some work in town in various different kinds of jobs. 

Mariana is 56 years old, married, and has given birth to 7 children, 5 of them are married and live on their own, he daughter is single and works and Mariana helps her a little financially, and her youngest son is studying in a local high school. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and the house they live in is their own. 

Mariana works hard in her line of work, raising pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. She also works in agriculture during the harvest in her community. 

This new credit will be invested in purchasing pigs and feed for the animals as well as fertilizer for her crops. 

Her goal is to make the hen house for her chickens bigger and to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: purchase pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Riyo

texts.en: Riyo is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara who wants to work in a major port, either in Indonesia or abroad. The father of Riyo only works as a construction worker and his income is uncertain. His mother works as an employee in one of the private hospitals in Cilacap. The parents have only enough revenue to finance the day-to-day family expenses. Riyo still has one brother for his parents to raise. With his education, Riyo wants to help his parents for the betterment of his family. With the Student Loan program from Kiva, he wants to continue his studies. He is very grateful to all investors of Kiva who help with his studies even though they do not know him personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in their household expenditures. She has had this business for four years now. She also sells rice for additional income. She works hard to provide for her family.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of mineral water to expand her product. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their business and life every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her product

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Doña Marbely una humilde comerciante es dueña de una pulperia. Ella esta agradecida con kiva y MiCredito por el prestamo anterior otorgado  pues le permitio surtir su pulperia y ofrecer variedad de producto que ella no  tenia. Hoy esta solicitando este credito para comprar producto tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, pasta dental y un frezer. Ella siempre sigue con sus planes futuros de poner un salon de belleza.
texts.en: Marbely is a humble merchant and owner of a convenience store.  She is thankful for her previous loan from Kiva and MiCredito because it helped her continue running her store and to offer a larger variety of products than before. Today she is seeking another loan so that she can buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and a freezer. She is also moving forward with her future plans of opening a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and a freezer.

loans.name: Merrydelle Joy

texts.en:
Merrydelle Joy lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a little farm garden with a greater income for a living. She has been doing this for three years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizer for her garden. In the future, she hopes to expand her garden to gain more income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos de 23,22 y 16 años de edad respectivamente. Desde hace 35 años se dedica a la siembra maíz y fríjol. Antes solo cultivaba plátano que fue algo que le enseñaron sus padres; pero últimamente no le estaba generando buenas ganancias; por lo que decidió cultivar maíz y frijol.  Los insumos los adquiere en la ciudad que esta a 12 kilómetros de su comunidad; por lo que se ve obligado a pagar los servicios de un vehiculo privado para trasladar los insumos hasta su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de abono, pago de mano de obra para preparar la tierra, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. De esta manera, podrá proporcionar los insumos necesarios a su cultivo, para obtener una cosecha abundante y asegurar la alimentación de su familia y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, así como el estudio de ellos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 48 years old, he is married, and he has three children that are 23, 22 and 16 years old.  For the past 35 years he has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans.  Before that, his parents taught him how to grow bananas, but ultimately bananas didn't generate a good income.  This is why he decided to grow corn and beans instead.  The supplies he needs he can buy in the city, which is 12 kilometers (7.5 miles) from his home.  Therefore, he must pay for a private vehicle to transport the supplies that he needs to his home.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and pay for a laborer to help him prepare the land in order to cultivate 14,000 square meters (3.5 acres) of corn.  By doing this, he will be able to divide up the necessary supplies for his crop so that he can obtain an abundant harvest.  He does this so that he can provide for his family's needs and cover the basic costs for his children, as they are all in school.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and pay a laborer to prepare the land, in order to cultivate 14,000 square meters (3.5 acres) of corn.

loans.name: Juper

texts.en:
Juper is a farmer who is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is residing harmoniously together with his family in the village of Carmencita.

Farming is Juper's business and he's been working at this for almost 20 years.  Together with his wife, they are planting their 1-hectare farm together with some laborers that they pay.

Due to insufficient capital he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for sowing. This loan will allow him to continue his agricultural activities and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for sowing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle. Josephine has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Sin Límites  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sin Limites está formado por 10 mujeres que son amigas y familiares, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está  rodeada de mucha belleza natural, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada por lo que cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, es muy trabajadora ya que su principal meta es sacar en adelante sus familias y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Fabiola, está realizando su cuarto crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Sin Límites, le gusta su grupo por el compañerismo, la amistad y la unión de todas sus socias.

La Señora Fabiola tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 12, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su tercer hijo este año ingresa al jardín de infantes. Su esposo es artesano y se dedica al negocio familiar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Fabiola se dedica al negocio familiar, ellos elabora chocolate desde hace un año, trabaja todos los días sin horario ya que todo depende de los pedidos que tengan. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cacao.

Su meta es agrandar más su chocolatera.
texts.en:
The group Sin Limites is comprised of 10 women that are friends and relatives.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by natural beauty, its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern, it has 4 rivers marking its boundaries, and its gastronomy is varied so that all visitors can find food that they enjoy. The people of the city maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.  The people are hard-working and their main goal is to help their families get ahead so that they can provide a better future for their children.

One of the members of this group is Fabiola.  This is her fourth loan as a member of the Sin Limites group.  She likes the group because of its companionship, friendship, and the strong bond between the members.

Fabiola is 36 years old, she is married, and she has four children that are 14, 12, 4 and 1 years old.  The two oldest children are in high school and her 4 year-old is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a craftsman and works in the family business.  They do not own their own home but instead rent.

Fabiola works in the family business.  For the past year, she has been making chocolate.  She works every day without a set schedule, as her work depends on the orders that she receives.

With this loan she will invest in the purchase of cocoa.

Her ultimate goal is to grow her chocolate business.

loans.use: to buy cocoa.

loans.name: Mahfisa

texts.ru: Махфиса трудолюбивая и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем и занимается шитьем женской одежды. Махфиса начала свой бизнес 2 года назад, после того как она окончила курс шитья и кройки. Махфиса вначале имела 1 швейную машинку. Данное время она имеет 3 швейных машинок. Махфиса имеет 2 учениц, которые помогают ей введению бизнеса. Махфиса постепенно развевает бизнес и увеличивает доход. После того как она начала бизнес уровень проживания постепенно улучшается. Она хочет купить еще одну швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1200 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahfisa is a hardworking and purposeful young woman. She is 27 years old. She is not married and sews women's clothing. Mahfisa has started her business two years ago after she has completed the course in sewing. Mahfisa had one sewing machine at first. At this time she has three sewing machines. She has two students who help her in the business. Mahfisa gradually grows her business and increases her income. After she has started her business her living conditions are gradually improving. She wants to buy one more sewing machine. Mahfisa is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,200 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Expedito está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comités, en donde ellas por medio de su esfuerzo y la ayuda que cada una se da, están mejorando. Una de estas mujeres es La Sra. Lourdes, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer casada, tiene 3 hijo, es una mujer muy activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Ella cuenta que se dedica a las ventas varias de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad, también dice, que lucha por sus hijos, para poder darles un futuro digno y sin privaciones.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, etc, para poder venderlos y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, procurando crecer.
texts.en:
The group called San Expedito is in its third loan cycle. Due to their effort and the help that each member provides one another, they are all improving.  One of these women is Lourdes.  She is the president of the group and she is married with three children.  She is an active woman and a strong supporter of strengthening each woman in the group.  

She sells a variety of basic products and she says that everything she does is for her children.  She wants to provide them with a dignified future without deprivation.

Today she is seeking a loan so that she can buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, breads, rice, beverages, oil, flour, etc. to sell them.  She wants to continue working in sales with the intent of growing her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, breads, rice, beverages, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesus está está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ya que así podrán saber la situación de cada una de las integrantes. 6 de estas mujeres están en el nivel rojo, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel rojo. Ella es consciente que la única forma de mejorar ese nivel es trabajando el doble y esforzarse cada día mas. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, y hoy solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas, y de esa forma implementar sus ventas, mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The group Niño Jesus is working hard in the struggle against poverty.  All of the group members understand poverty intimately.  Six of the women are in the red level, which is to say that their income is very low.

Lilian is one of the group members who, in the latest poll, was determined to be at a level of poverty inside the red.  She understands that the only way to improve her circumstances is to work double and to fight harder.  She sells shoes and today she is seeking a loan so that she can buy clothing.  By selling clothing along with shoes, she hopes to increase her sales and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy clothing so that she can expand her shoe-selling business.

loans.name: Grâce Divine 1 Group

texts.fr: GRÂCE DIVINE 1 est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jacqueline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 57 ans. Jacqueline est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et un reste à  sa charge. Jacqueline vit seule avec son enfant restant à sa charge. Jacqueline n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de son enfant, Jacqueline mène comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Jacqueline  achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Jacqueline sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Jacqueline et au second membre du groupe GRÂCE DIVINE 1 d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Grace Divine I is a two-person group, of whom the members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Jacqueline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 57 years old. She is a widow and a mother of three children. Some of the children have gone to school, and one is still under her care.

Jacqueline lives alone with the child who still is under her care. She has never went to school.

In order to take care of and ensure the needs of her child, Jacqueline has been selling charcoal from her home for 15 years. She buys her goods in a Benin market. 

This is the second time that Jacqueline has asked for a loan through Alide, a loan which will allow her and the second member of the Grace Divine I group to increase their stock and to better respond to the needs of the customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Amina Aïcha's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Amina Aïcha (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans. Amina Aïcha est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Ouro. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Amina Aïcha n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Amina Aïcha vit avec son mari et ses enfants.
