Kavumbi is 53 years old, married, and a mother of three children. One of them is still in school. For the past twelve years, Kavumbi has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

Kavumbi was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She will use the loan to buy additional dairy equipment to use in her business, such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from, and so on. Kavumbi will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child who is in school, and to expand her farming activities.

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view toward increasing her income, so as to help improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy equipment, such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from, and so on.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 32-year-old mother from Kakamega, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is married to Bernard, who is a farmer and supports the family by providing the income. She has two children who are ten and five years old.

Carolyne has a retail shop which she has been running for the last seven years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,600. She has applied for her third loan which she will use to purchase goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil and bar soap to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Carolyne's dream is to have a big business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil and bar soap to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PAZ Y PROGRESO * 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Hilaria,   tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 6 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de flores en su puesto de venta en un mercado de la zona central de la ciudad de la Paz,   este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Hilaria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de flores por mayor ya que por estas fechas realiza ramos para la venta y tiene también pedido para distintos acontecimientos sociales su razón para solicitar este préstamo es poder entregar estos pedidos ya que le hace falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Hilaria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son poder expandirse en gran la variedad de flores decorativas para interiores y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la expansión de su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le dan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos solas mantienen a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship group Paz Y Progresso *26 is composed of eight members, all of them women. Hilaria is the president of the group. She is 28 years old and has two children who are aged six and eight. 

Hilaria makes a living by selling flowers in her stall in a market in the centre of La Paz. This is her second loan cycle. Hilaria will use this loan to buy a variety of flowers in bulk, because she makes bouquets for sale around this time and has requests for several social events. She needs to fulfil these orders and lacks the working capital. 

Hilaria faces challenges, namely expanding the range of interior and decorative flowers, and will use the loan to expand her business. 

She is happy and thankful for this opportunity that has been given to her and the rest of the group members, since they very often have to support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (various flowers)

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 28-year-old mother from Nyalenda, which is one of the slums in Kisumu city within the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family and is married to Samuel, who is also a small scale businessman. She has four children who are ten, six, four and two years old.

She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last ten years and generates a monthly income of KES 40,000. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes so as to increase her stock. This will enable her to get more income to support her family and sustain the business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to grow the business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Kwasi's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two men who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in retail business. This is their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Kwasi is the group's representative. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of two boys. Kwasi sells used jeans at the city market. He plans to use his portion of the loan to buy a bale of men's jeans for GHS 1,200. He has more than eight years of experience in his field. He will use his profits to meet his children's needs and increase his savings with ID-Ghana.

The other borrower is named Aaron.

loans.use: to buy a bale of men's jeans for GHS 1200.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items llike beans, rice, flour and dry cassava

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married and has seven children, three of whom are in school. She resides in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Deborah's monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.  

Deborah operates a restaurant and has been in this business for four years. Her restaurant is her sole income-generating activity. She works from home seven days a week and sells only on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.    

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more green bananas, onions, cooking oil, beef, fresh beans, rice, and chicken. Deborah aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and buy a plot of land on which to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, rice, beef, onions, cooking oil, fresh beans, and chicken

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 38 year-old man from Majengo, in Kakamega county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports four family members and is married to Polline who is a businesswoman. He has one child who is two years old.

Thomas owns a shop, a business he has been doing for the last 3 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase items for his shop, such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and soap in bulk for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his business.

Thomas's dream and hope is to create employment opportunities for others by expanding his business, so as to employ more people to help him run the business. He also wishes to give his child the best education possible.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and soap, among others.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 38-year-old lady from the Eregi location, which is found in Vihiga County in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is married to Mr. Elphas, who is a small-scale farmer. She has two school-going children of ages 10 and 5 years old respectively.

Carolyne has a green grocery store within her local market, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She gets an income of KES 4,650 monthly. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase green grocery products for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Carolyne's dream is to educate her children and run a successful business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of green grocery products.

loans.name: Belindah

texts.en:
Belindah is a 36-year-old lady. She is married to Rodgers, a businessman, and they have three children, ages 3, 12, and 14.

Belindah has been operating a retail shop for the last five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase goods for her retail shop. The items she will purchase include bar soap, cooking oil, and washing powder. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Belindah's dream is to educate her children and run a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 30-year-old married man. He lives with his wife Khatuna in a small village of Sighnaghi district. Zurab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and rabbits. In addition, they have a vineyard and produce wine seasonally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Zurab will purchase a used car and two calves. As the calves are raised, he will be able to resell them at a higher price. Zurab will drive a car in the vineyard. When the car is purchased, he will be able to work more easily. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a used car and two calves

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya lives in a small city called Sevan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Although Sevan is small, it is one of the most beautiful cities of the republic of Armenia, Zoya says. The lake in Sevan is a very nice and safe place to rest with family members and friends. There are a lot of interesting stories and beautiful legends connected with the lake of Sevan and its surroundings. For this reason, Sevan is frequently visited both by local citizens and tourists. 

Since Zoya specializes in sales, she has established her own retail business in Sevan. She rents a stall at the Sevan wholesale market, where she sells a large variety of products. She sells products that are seasonal as well as those needed for everyday use. In her stall, she sells boots, sneakers and rubber shoes along with a large variety of household goods. Zoya's family members are very happy and satisfied with the results of her business. 

Thanks to her business income, Zoya is able to provide for her elder daughter, who does not live with her, and her second daughter and her family, who live with her.

Zoya is a very clever businesswoman and she knows that this season is the best trading time. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy  seasonal products that are in great demand by tourists such as boots, sneakers and rubber shoes. She is sure that this loan will help her earn an increased income, especially since the summertime is a very busy time of year.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products (boots, sneakers and rubber shoes) that are in great demand by tourists.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is aged 38 and married. He has three children, all of whom attend school. He is a farmer, mainly growing coffee, matooke, maize and beans, for commercial purposes and home consumption. It is from agriculture that he gets money to look after his family.

Naboth has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings). He will use this amount to buy materials for completing his residential house. He plans to pay back the loan in installments, using the income from agriculture. He wants to see his family living in a modest environment that is conducive to their well-being.

His major challenge is the changeable weather conditions affecting production of crops, as well as the price fluctuations on the market.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completing his residential house

loans.name: Malita

texts.en: Malita is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil. She works six days out of very week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Kiva borrower. He is married with two children, aged 7 years and 15 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He sells ties to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. He faces a challenge of lack of funds for his business.

He has taken a loan of KES 26,500 to buy a gas cooker that will benefit his family. This will enable his family to prepare food well without the smoke experienced when using firewood.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker that will benefit his family.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She describes herself as trustworthy, humble, and God-fearing. To earn a living, Lilian sells clothes.

Lilian is requesting a loan of KES 10,840 to buy a gas cooker for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister and brother. 

Mariam has a business selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through crafts and catering services. She works from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mariam aspires to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as dependable. He has taken a loan of KES 6,800 to buy a solar lantern that will benefit the five members of his family.

The family faces a challenge of the lack of electricity in the area where they live, and also the cost of installing the electricity is high. The lantern will enable them to have lighting without having to pay any bills. 

Moses does welding to earn an income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a Kiva borrower aged 27 years, married with four children with ages between 7 years and one year old.He describes himself as dedicated and never gives up. He has taken out a loan of Kes 5,800 to buy a solar lantern that will benefit his family. His family faces a challenge of lack of electricity connection and high cost of paraffin. He spends a lot of money on fuel hence the need for a solar lantern  which will reduce fuel costs. 

Stephen transports customers from one place to another using his motorcycle to earn an income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He hopes that in future he will be able to afford a water tank.

loans.use: buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives in the city of Gavar, which is in Gegharkunik region. Before getting married, for several years Davit was engaged in a trading business in the Russian Federation, but having no success there, he came back to his motherland. Today he is married, and he is the father of two cheerful and clever boys.  Here, with his nice wife, he established a small farm, and by the help of farming income he managed to buy a truck. Together with his farming activities, today Davit also transports people in his truck. The farming he manages with his wife; they have a cow, two calves, three piglets and fifteen chickens.

Since their farm is very small, they have decided to enlarge it. Davit asks for a loan in order to buy several cows and a bull. He is more than sure that great success and decent income are awaiting his family.

loans.use: to buy several cows and a bull, and he is more than sure that great success and decent income are awaiting his family

loans.name: Andres Fidel

texts.es:
Andres tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la compañera y con el hijo en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar un solar para construir una casa, en los tiempos libres le gusta ver las noticias en la letelevision
texts.en:
Andres is 25 years old and he is in a common-law relationship. He has one child and lives with his partner and their child in the precinct of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is originally from Terrenal, which is in the precinct of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. He makes a living in livestock and agriculture. In agriculture, he works planting corn and rice. 

With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to prevent pests and diseases. He makes his purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

His dream is to buy a plot of land where he can build a house. In his free time, he likes to watch the news on TV.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to prevent pests and diseases

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 20 years old. He lives in the Gardabani district with his mother and 4-year-old brother. In spite of his young age, Mikheil is the only income provider in the family, working as a daily worker in the local fields. He started working in early childhood and his small seasonal income is a primary income source for his family members. However, his earnings are not enough to cover the cost of food and everyday expenses. For this reason, Mikheil decided to start a dairy farm. 

Mikheil's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Mikheil will place the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard and he will sell the milk at the local market. He estimates that the family's income will increase by 150 to 200 GEL, which is a 40- to 50-percent increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, enabling them to access regular credit products that are currently available.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and employ more staff for her restaurant

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her younger brother’s child. She and her family live in a house and have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

Joyce operates a restaurant and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market six days every week. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, rice, beef, chicken and ground nuts.   

She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and educate her children up to university-level.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, beef, chicken, rice, sweet and Irish potatoes, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
For Jennifer, passion is the name of the game. “Dance has been a long-time passion of mine,” says Jennifer. “I’ve danced for 30 years of my life and want to share my love for it with young girls.” 

Originally from Chicago, Jennifer purchased a dance studio from its original owner six years ago. She offers dance lessons for several kinds of dance: ballet, tap, hip hop, pop, and waltz. She currently has around 130 students enrolled, but expects to see enrollment numbers rise during the summer months. In anticipation of this increased demand, she needs this financing to make renovations to her current space to improve the appearance of the school, and to purchase a new computer system to improve her customer service.

loans.use: To make renovations to her current space and purchase a new computer system

loans.name: Lisa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 24-year-old Emmaculate from Mutare. Emmaculate is a group member of the group called Lisa Group. She is married with two children and are both attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Emmaculate runs a clothing business which sells African attire and baby wear. The business has been in operation  for six years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of industrial sewing machines. Emmaculate has requested a loan of $400 to buy an overlock machine for the sewing business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. 

In the future Emmaculate plans to operate her business in town where there are more clients.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine for the sewing business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 35-year old Kiva borrower. She describes herself as God-fearing and hopeful. Ruth farms for a living.

She is married and has five children who are between the ages of 1 and 16. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,600 to buy a 2,300 liter water tank. Her family faces a challenge of accessing clean water and this tank will benefit her eight-member family. The tank will enable them to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is Ruth's second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She hopes to provide both physical and spiritual security for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank, gutters and iron sheets

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Kiva borrower aged 30 years. He is married and has four children with ages between 10 years and 2 years old. He describes himself as dedicated and determined. 

He has borrowed a loan of Kes 5,800 to buy a solar lantern that will benefit his family.They do not have electricity hence the need for a solar lantern. He will also be able to reduce kerosene expenses and mobile charging expenses since they will be able to charge their phones with the solar lamp. 

David transports customers from one place to another to earn an income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima, 23, lives in New Kru town. She is married and has two children, ages five and seven, who are in school. Maima has completed the 12th grade. 

Maima's husband works as a driver. For the past four years, Maima's has been operating a table business where she sells slippers, cream, and handbags. She started this business by selling what goods she could afford in her local community. She learned about this type of selling from her friends.

Maima is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, cream, and handbags for her business. She plans is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, cream, and handbags for her business

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is 43 years old and lives in Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. While she received no formal education, she is married to a teacher and is the mother of two children, ages 10 and 5, both of whom are in school.

Describing herself as a hardworking person, for the past four years Miatta has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, etc. in the local market, a business she started with money given to her by her mother. She transports her goods to market via a shared taxi.

Now requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, etc. for her business, Miatta plans to buy land and build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, which enables small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, etc. for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Kiva borrower aged 33 years, married with two children aged 5 years and 18 months old.. He has taken a loan of Kes 5,800 to buy a solar lamp. The family faces a challenge of accessing electricity and the cost of paraffin is high hence the need for solar lamp.

Joseph transports customers using his motorcycle to earn an income.This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.He hopes that in future he will be able to build a permanent home fitted with a water tank and a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Days Of Our Lives Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Tambudzai from Mutare. She is the group leader to the group called Days of Our Lives.  She is married with three children, one attending school.  

Tambudzai runs a retail business selling vegetables. The business has been in operation for five years. She says challenge faced is high transport cost. Tambudzai has requested a loan of $600 to buy vegetables (carrots, onions, spinach, butternuts) to supply to those who are in catering businesses in town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare.

 In the future Tambudzai plans to buy her own truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from farms in peri-urban areas to supply them to catering businesses in town

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with one child. He describes himself as humble. He has taken a loan of Kes 21,000 to buy a water tank of 3,000 litres that will benefit three family members.The family faces a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities.They will now be able to store enough clean water for domestic use.

James sells milk from his dairy cows to earn an income. He hopes that in future he will live comfortably. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is Musu, a 42-year-old married mother of one child, aged 23. She has one additional dependent who lives with her and works as a sales assistant.

In 2008, Musu established her used carpets and chairs business, located in the city center, to help her husband in the running of their home. She works seven days a week and ten hours a day, earning about 1,200,000 SLL every month.

Musu is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more carpets and chairs. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her monthly profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more carpets and chairs.

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George is a single man aged 27 years old, but has three siblings whom he looks after and for whom he pays tuition. 

He operates a motorcycle spare parts business in Kagadi town and he has been doing it since 2010. George received a loan of UGX 800,000 from Ugafode to boost his business and he says it helped him to increase on the capital as well as the returns.

George now wants another loan of UGX.1,300,000 to buy more spare parts for the business and meet the increasing demand. His dream is to expand his business and start selling motorcycles in the area.

However, George says his challenge is the limited capital in his business and the changing business conditions, most especially in seasons when people do not have money to spare. But George is a hard-working person and would like Ugafode to continue supporting him financially.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Kiva borrower aged 45 years. She describes herself as competent and social. She has taken a loan of Kes 21,000 to buy a water tank of 3,000 litres that will benefit her family and community. Her family faces a challenge of insufficient water supply hence the need for a water tank that will enable them store clean water for domestic use.

Martha keeps livestock and also does farming to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will be able to educate her children and improve people's lives in the community.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Faafeu

texts.en: Faafeu is a 63-year-old woman who is married and has seven children. She has a small business: a taro and banana plantation. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Faafeu will use the loan to buy cement, iron roofing, and timber. She will also use part of her loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a wheelbarrow, and a bush knife. Faafeu joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron roofing, timber, chemicals, a spade, a wheelbarrow and a bush knife

loans.name: Maraka

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Maraka. He is married and has three children, aged 26, 21 and 18 years.

In 2000, Maraka established his shop. He has a bachelor degree in physics and mathematics. After spending twenty years in the classroom, Maraka realized he can improve his life faster in business than in the classroom. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,800,000 as profit, every month, from his business. 

He is asking for a loan of SLL 5,000,000. He would like to use SLL 2,000,000 to buy crates of soft drinks, SLL 1,000,000 to buy assorted provisions, like powdered milk, butter, etcetera, SLL 1,500,000 to buy detergent, and SLL 500,000 for transport costs. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 600,000.  Maraka has succeeded in beginning to sell at wholesale, to customers. He says thanks, KIVA and ARD, for the kind support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, detergent, and assorted provisions like powdered milk, butter, etcetera, and to pay transport costs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
While living in the Dominican Republic, Juana had always worked with children as a teacher in a variety of schools. After moving to the United States, she knew it would be difficult for her to continue her intended career path. She started out by working at a multiservice agency but when the company closed, she was left unemployed for over a year. She was forced to declare bankruptcy as she could not find work to make ends meet. 

Taking matters into her own hands, Juana went back to school to study business and English. Her next step was to take the necessary courses to become a daycare provider. “I can say without hesitation that working with children is my passion; I have always wanted to do this, ever since I moved to the United States,” says Juana. Initially, she obtained a license for up to 6 children but now has the capacity to take on 10 children: 8 regular and 2 after-school children. She believes her biggest accomplishment to date is to have a running day care center and to be able to support her daughter and father.

loans.use: to pay for new daycare equipment including toys, posters, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy premium used clothes packets, which she can sell by the piece at good prices

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, one of whom is in school, Margie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Margie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, spices, shampoo, milk, and soap. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her general store and raising pigs business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, spices, and shampoo

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.es: Don Flaviano, una persona de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta tercero intermedio, tiene 4 hijos. Una persona muy respetuosa y humilde. El vive en el tropico hace 30 años atras, perteneciente al municipio de Chimore. Trabajo desde muy joven an la agricultura con la producción de platano, banano, piña en su chaco. Ahora ya con el pasar de los años poco a poco redujo su producción por que ya no cuenta con la misma fuerza de antes y sus hijos ya se independizaron, solo tiene uno que lo ayuda en el chaco. Actualmente solo esta produciendo citricos la cosecha de este producto es una vez al año, por eso el solicita ahora el credito para la compra de una motocicleta para trabajar como mototaxista en su tiempo libre y tener un ingreso permanente. Y mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flaviano is 54 years old and has four children.  He studied through the third year of intermediate school.  He is a respectful and humble person.  He has lived in the tropics for 30 years in the town of Chimore.  He has worked since he was young as a farmer, planting bananas, plantains, and pineapple on his farm.  Now that the years have passed, he is reducing his production little by little since he does not have the same strength as he used to and his children are becoming independent and he only has one who helps with the farm.  Currently he is only producing citrus since that is only harvested once a year.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase a motorcycle so that he can work as a mototaxi driver in his free time and have a permanent income.  This will improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marcelo Teodoro

texts.es:
Marcelo tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la compañera y con el hijo en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Marcelo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es viajar a la playa, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Marcelo, age 47, is in a common-law marriage and has one child. He lives with his life partner and child in Recinto Terrenal in the Pueblo Viejo canton in the Los Ríos province. He belongs to the Terrenal communal bank, which is in Recinto Terrenal in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members work in agriculture and with livestock.

Marcelo grows corn and rice. With the loan he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases. He makes his purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

His dream is to travel to the beach. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in traditional hand-carved masks. She would like to invest in a purchase of wood, metal plates and paints to increase production.

Evelyn has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"My greatest inspiration is to preserve our rich cultural heritage. Initially, I wasn't using lots of different materials, but now I use recycled glass and glass beads, aluminum, brass and more. I sit and draw the mask creatively, and come up with the colors that will make it stand out."

"Thank you all for this microcredit. Having more of the materials I need, I'll be able to build up my stock and hopefully increase my sales."

Use the link below to view Evelyn's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6750

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of wood, metal plates and paints to increase production

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
José is an artisan from Guatemala, who specializes in handcrafted ceramic sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies, including paints, varnish and brushes.

Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"My favorite thing to do is to create new designs and I love the challenge of crafting and painting them by hand. Each design is proof of the richness of our culture. Working with ceramics has brought me many beautiful things, from learning the craft from my mother and uncles, to providing for my family so that my four children can go to the university. I already have a grandchild and my wish for all of them is that they become independent people with a career of their choice. That they be responsible and be respectful of God."

"I would like to thank you all for your support through this microcredit, because I can continue crafting when I have a good stock of the necessary materials. Thank you very much!"

Use the link below to view Jose's ceramic art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7521

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies, including paints, varnish and brushes

loans.name: Hely

texts.en:
Hely and his wife, Endang, are Javanese artisans who specialize in batik art on wood. They would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wooden masks to increase production.

Hely has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"My wife Endang and I like to create designs that are different from those existing today, and we started in 2005. We chose wood batik because it combines the uniqueness of batik on wood, the Javanese culture, and the beauty of wood carving. Our batik designs are mostly contemporary, and are sometimes combined with beads and certain wood finishing techniques."

"We are so grateful for the opportunity to receive this microcredit, because it will make it possible to purchase the materials we need for our batik on wood products. We work with two carvers and they take a long time to carve; when they're busy with other projects they will stop carving ours, which delays our own work. If we could pay the order up front, we could build up a stock of materials and get to work on the products whenever we're ready to go on to the next piece. Thank you for supporting in our efforts to make the business grow."

Use the link below to view Hely's wood batik masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6572

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wooden masks to increase production

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in silver filigree jewelry. Jose would like to purchase sterling silver in bulk and build up a bigger stock of his handcrafted filigree jewelry designs.

Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I was born in the city of Lima. I grew up there with my father, a carpenter; and my mother, a nurse. After high school, I took courses in jewelry making with emphasis in filigree. I began working with silver when I was 19 and realized I like this art a lot and I have fun doing it. I began doing simple work like chains, then decided to learn different techniques for this beautiful craft. I believe I was born for this kind of work and I love everything about it."

"I send a big hug from far away to all of you who are helping finance this microcredit. Thanks to you, I'll be able to create more of my most popular designs and my little workshop will be able to grow. I really, really appreciate it."

Use the link below to view Jose's silver filigree jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8065

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver in bulk and build up a bigger stock of his handcrafted filigree jewelry designs

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is a 56-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, making and selling pancakes. Temukisa is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, baking powder and dripping oil. Temukisa joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, baking powder, dripping oil and school fees.

loans.name: Esther 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the group coordinator of Esther 1, 3, & 4, which is made up of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. Margarita enjoys working and being at her home with her family. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children with a new baby coming soon. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business. She dreams of having a successful business and bringing change to her family.

Margarita operates a business selling miscellaneous items like cosmetics, shoes, and clothes. She will use the loan to purchase dozens of these items to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 14th loan with Esperanza International; as with each loan she has been able to invest in her business and improve it, making it possible to provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, etc.)

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver for continued production.

Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"My childhood was spent appreciating natural beauty, like the Pacific Ocean with its colorful fish, blue waters, sand, rocks and sunsets. In the Andes, I came into contact with the culture of my ancestors, the Inca. Then I visited the Amazon rainforest. I began designing jewelry and then went on to craft everything I see in silver and precious stones.  Some of my friends tell me I'm a dreamer. I tell them that the only way to create is first to dream."

"I would like to send you a hug and good vibes to all of you for this microcredit. It's so comforting to know there's a friendly hand willing to support you..."

Use the link below to view Luis's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5549

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver for continued production

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Raquel and her husband Gregor specialize in alpaca gloves, scarves and hats. They would like to invest in the purchase of alpaca yarn for increased production.

Raquel has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"My husband and I are dedicated to preserving Peruvian textile traditions. What draws us to weaving is the opportunity to work with natural fibers by rescuing ancient Inca weaving techniques. We love to see the transformation of loose yarns into garments and accessories. We help an Andean community by employing weavers on traditional looms who then help us finish each piece by hand."

"On behalf of our family we would like to thank you all so much for this microcredit, which is a great support for us. May God bless you."

Use the link below to view Raquel's alpaca accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5826

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of alpaca yarn for increased production

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a 27-year-old woman who is married with one child. She has a small business, a banana plantation. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house so that her family can have better living conditions. Akenese will use the loan to buy timber, roofing sheets, cement, nails and sand. Akenese joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timber, roofing sheets, cement, nails and sand.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 30 años, dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 7 años,  ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista, pedicurista y también maquillaje y peinados en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de la Guardia de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de cremas para la cara para el cabello pestañas, esmaltes que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Maria  es tener un salón de belleza reconocido por las clientes por el buen trabajo que ella realiza.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and has two children who are 3 and 7 years old.  She offers manicures, pedicures, makeup, and hairstyling at her beauty salon, which is located in the Guardia area of the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first with the institution.  

Maria will use this loan to purchase supplies for her beauty salon like face cream, hair cream, eyelashes, and nail polish that she needs.  This will help increase her working capital.  Maria faces challenges with her business liking having more coverage in the market.  She will use the benefits of the loan to continue purchasing materials and improving her business.  Maria's dream is to have a beauty salon that is well known by her customers for the good work that she does.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: El señor Remberto vive en la localidad de Isarzama,  junto a su hijo y su esposa, en un lote urbano que adquirieron con esfuerzo y dedicación de los años trabajados.  Se dedican al área agrícola  producen en su terreno plátano, yuca y arroz, la venta de sus productos agrícolas la realizan a los intermediarios que generalmente vienen a comprar al lugar de la cosecha, obtiene buenos ingresos en la gestión. La producción es familiar y también contrata personas eventuales que le colaboran en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. El señor Remberto está solicitando el crédito para el mantenimiento del cultivo de platano, ya que el lugar es una zona bananera, donde también posteriormente ampliara esta producción. Con el presente crédito tendrá el señor Remberto una producción limpia libre de malezas y fertilizada, y  lograra cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Remberto lives in Isarzama with his wife and child.  He lives on an urban piece of land that they acquired with years of effort and dedication to work.  They devote themselves to agriculture, and  they produce bananas, yucca, and rice on their land.

They sell their agricultural products to intermediaries who generally come to buy at the harvest location.  He gets good income from the arrangement.  It is a family production, and he also hires temporary workers that help him with crop maintenance.

Remberto is requesting the loan for maintenance of his banana crops.  The place is a banana zone, and he will subsequently increase this production.  

With this loan Remberto will have a production that is fertilized and free of weeds.  He will manage to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his banana crop.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eleven children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of household items to sell at her store, like soap, milk, canned goods, and sugar.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of household items to sell at her store, like soap and canned goods

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for cooking meals at her restaurant, like meat, spices, and vegetables.

Precy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for cooking meals at her restaurant, like meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Gloria is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal for her buy-and-sell charcoal business. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Viviana Vanessa

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Viviana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y tiene un criadero de tuchas. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y balanceado para los peces.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es tener dinero para que su hijo estudie y sea un buen profesional, en los tiempos le gusta cocer, bordar y teger.
texts.en:
Viviana, age 24, is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  She lives with her husband and son in the Recinto Terrenal, which is in the Pueblo Viejo canton in the Los Ríos province.

She belongs to the Terrenal communal bank in the Recinto Terrenal in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The people work in agriculture and with livestock.

Viviana grows corn, and she has a trout farm.  With the loan she will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, insecticides to avoid pests, and balanced feed for the fish.  She makes her purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

Her dream is to have money so that her son can get an education and become a good professional.  In her free time she likes to sew, to embroider, and to knit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, insecticide to avoid pests, and balanced feed for fish.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pawid making (woven nipa palm mat used for house repair and construction) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc. for her pawid making business. Editha has been in this business for six years. Editha earns more income from her general store. Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Ruby works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell young coconut business. Ruby is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business. Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Rachel works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Rachel is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to resell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business. Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en: Cherrylyn is 37 years old and married with six children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherrylyn has a young coconut juice selling business in the Philippines. Cherrylyn requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional young coconuts and plastic cups for her business. Cherrylyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cherrylyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional young coconuts and plastic cups for her business.

loans.name: Tomas Bienvenido

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene uin hijo vive con la compañera y con el hijo que tiene 4 añso en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Tomas se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz . Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas .  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando y tener dienro para invertir en otra semilla, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Tomas is 27 years old and is in a common law marriage.  He lives with his partner and their four year old son in Terrenal Village in Pueblo Viejo, a canton of the province of Los Rios.  He is a member of the Terrenal Loan Group which is located in the village of Terrenal in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  Tomas works as an agricultural laborer planting corn.  

With this loan, he will be able to purchase supplies such as: fertilizers, manure and pesticides to prevent pests and disease.  He buys his supplies in the city of Pueblo Viejo.  His dream is to buy land to continue growing his crops and have enough money to invest in other crops.  In his free time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure and insecticide to prevent pests and disease

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely, vive con su familia. Ella, posee una tienda de productos de la canasta basica, asimismo elaboración y venta de tortillas, tambien comida, realiza dicha actividad para adqurir ingresos y aportar a su familia.El préstamo que requiere le ayudara al fortalecimiento  en el negocio y crecer más; esta inversión le permitira comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, entre otros.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y apoyar a su hija siempre.
texts.en:
Arely lives with her family. She runs a grocery store, and she also makes and sells tortillas and meals. She runs this acridity to earn an income and provide for her family. The loan she is requesting will help her strengthening her activity and making it grow even more. With this loan she will be able to buy a variety of products such as rice, beans, sugar and salt.
She wishes to always succeed in granting a better standard of living to her family as well as to constantly be able to support her daughter.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar and salt.
